loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. supplies food items to her customers in the neighboring town. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities, which she sells to her customers in smaller quantities. She is a single parent with 1 child. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, allowing her to purchase more food items per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Nigeria, a neighboring country to Benin, Mrs. Chérifatou A. comes from the north of Benin. She is married and the mother of five children; Karim (20) is no longer in school, Roukyath (17) is in eighth grade, Kazim (12) is in seventh grade, Soulé (10) is in third grade, and Rokiath (8) in first grade. Mrs. Chérifatou A. travels to North-Benin to purchase cocoyams which she distributes to her customers, selling what is left over by the pile at her shop. She is requesting this loan so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva voluneer

Née vers 1970 au Nigéria dans un pays voisin du BENIN, dame A. Chérifatou est originaire du Nord BENIN. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont Karim âgé de 20 ans ne fréquente plus, Roukyath âgée de 17 ans est en classe de Quatrième, Kazim âgé de 12 ans est en classe de Cinquième, Soulé âgé de 10 ans est en classe de CM1 et Rokiath âgée de 8 ans est en classe de CP. Dame A. Chérifatou voyage au Nord-Bénin pour l'approvisionnement de tubercules d'igname qu'elle vient distribuer à ses clients et expose ensuite le reste devant sa boutique pour vendre en tas. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour donner satisfaction à sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 25 sacks of cocoyams

Achat de 25 sacs de tubercules d'igname.

loans.name: Avelina And Nancy Group

texts.en:
Avelina and Nancy are members of the Brisas Village Bank. Avelina, a separated mother of four children, sells emoliente (a hot drink with curative properties) by cart on a crowded street from morning to late night. Nancy, a 21-year-old mother of one son, sells ice cream that she acquires from her mother-in-law by cart in front of a high school. Furthermore, in her spare time Nancy helps make the ice cream and gets paid for it. Avelina and Nancy need a loan to invest in linseed, sugar, kerosene and ice cream ingredients.

Avelina and Nancy’s dreams are to improve their lives, have all the basic services necessary to live, finish their studies and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: To invest in linseed, sugar, kerosene and ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Zumra

texts.en:
Zumra is from the town of Kalesija. She lives with her husband, who is a pensioner. More specifically, he receives a pension in the amount of 340 KM per month. Moreover, he and Zumra work in the poultry industry.

They already have some chickens, but they are requesting a loan to buy more chickens. In turn, they plan on fattening the chickens they purchase and then selling them after some time. They state that they would like to proceed in this manner because they are often at home and need both a job to fill their free time and more money to cover their expenses during the winter months.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in jewelry in order to increase her income and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa cumplió 58 años D. edad, estudió primer año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. siete hijos, todos mayores D. edad y vive en la parcialidad D. Alintuyo. distrito D. Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno.

Es integrante del Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio” en Alintuyo. Con su crédito inicial aumentó su capital y compró 01 un equipo D. sonido con S/.500. A los 16 años D. edad tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces empezó el negocio D. compra y venta D. papa, chuño, camote, los cuales los vendía en las ferias D. Mazocruz los días sábados y los domingos en Ilave, también compraba maíz en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y vendía en la feria D. Ilave, Por poco tiempo, también se dedica a confeccionar soguillas, la cuales vendía en la feria D. Ayaviri. En estos momentos se dedica al negocio D. artefactos domésticos, negocio que lo tiene desD. que cumplió los 20 años D. edad.

Con este crédito D. S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, aumentará su capital y comprará 02 televisores a colores cada uno a S/.500.

Su sueño es que sus dos hijos mayores obtengan sus Títulos, ya que está estudiando en, la ciudad D. Arequipa y en cuanto al negocio seguir incrementando más el capital.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old, studied up to the first year of primary school, is married, is the mother of seven adult children, and lives in the Alintuyo neighborhood of the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the "24 D. Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. With her first loan she increased her working capital and bought a sound system with S/.500. When she was 16 years old she started her own household and since then she started her business buying and selling potatoes, chuño, and sweet potato, which she sold in the Mazocruz on Saturdays and Sundays in Ilave. She also bought corn I the city of Desaguadero and sold it in the Ilave market. For a short time she also worked making soguillas, which she sold in the Ayaviri market. At this time she works selling housewares, a business she has had since she was 20 years old. With this loan of S/.800, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will increase her working capital and will buy two color televisions, each one for S/.500. Her dream is for her two oldest children to obtain their university degrees as they are already studying in the city of Arequipa and in terms of the business she wants to continue increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy two televisions.

loans.name: Palmeras Amarillas Group

texts.es:
G/S PALMERAS AMARILLAS, nace por la necesidad de hacer crecer su negocio, esta miembros del g/s son vecinas  viven en la villa 26 de febrero un barrio de la ciudad de Masaya, son de condición humildes, a veces expresivas otras muy calladas, son respetuosas y de trato muy amable. Iniciaron su negocio por la necesidad de obtener ingresos que les ayuden a soportar la carga económica de sus compañeros, por vivir cerca de un colegio, esto les permita tener el negocio en sus casas ya que sus productos los ofertan a los estudiantes, que además de ser baratos son atractivos para la edad escolar.
   Doña Angélica  ha ido ofertando mas productos  entre los cuales están los helados puestos que con el crédito de Adim compro una refrigeradora, la que le permite ofrecer a los estudiantes y vecinos  gaseosa, hielo y helados 
Las miembros de este g/s sueñan con llegar a tener una pulpería, debido a su tenacidad ellas saben que lo va a   lograr, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposos e hijos mayores el  cual han sido muy colaboradores en los proyectos que emprenden su mama.
texts.en:
The group “Palmeras amarillas” began out of the necessity to grow their businesses. These members are neighbors that live in the Villa 26 of February neighborhood of Masaya city. They are humble, at times expressive and other times quiet, they are respectful and friendly. They began their business out of the necessity of obtaining additional income to support their homes. As they live close to a school, this enables them to have the business in their homes as their products are offered to students, in addition to being in expensive and attractive to school age customers. Doña Angélica has been offering many products including ice cream because with the loan from Adim she bought a refrigerator that allows her to offer the students and neighbors soda pop, ice and ice cream. The members of this group dream of having a convenience store. With their tenacity they know that they are going to achieve it, as they have the support of their spouses and older children in supporting the projects that their wives and mothers have undertaken.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Offer a greater variety of products

loans.name: Saut's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan intended for three individuals who live in Vatkor Commune in Battambang Province, Cambodia: 

Saut H., 47, buys vegetables from a farmer and sells them at the local market. She has been doing this since 2007, and currently earns approximately $2 a day. She is married with six children, all of whom are single. Her husband, Moeun Kong, 38, drives a motorcycle taxi. Saut is applying for a loan to purchase additional vegetables for resale. Saut serves as the lead borrower for this loan.

Moeun N., 51, is single  and also makes a living selling vegetables. She requests a loan to enlarge her business.

Moeurn N., 42, sells porridge on the side of the road in her village. She is seeking a loan in order to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa P. D. R. is sixty-eight years old. She lives with her retired husband in the tropical Amazon River basin region in eastern Peru. Rosa supports herself and her family through her juice selling business. Rosa is also a member of the Talented Women communal bank; she has taken out loans through her group for two years, at first to help implement a groceries business and now to fund a juice and beverage sales stand.

Rosa is requesting 1,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase materials with which she will concoct her beverages and juices. She is also planning to invest in one case of eggs and one case of milk to sell in her bodega. Rosa will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: Rosa would like to buy supplies for her juice stand, and to buy milk and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
El caballero Carlos L. desde hace seis años se ha dedicado a su negocio de carnicería el cual fundó con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos económicos y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.

Con gran ahínco y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y a pesar de los infortunios que en ocasiones presenta la vida, este caballero ha llevado el sustento a su amada familia. La razón por la que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la carne para comercializarla. Es importante destacar que dicho crédito le urge que sea entregado lo más pronto posible para continuar con su desarrollo en el negocio hoy en día.
texts.en:
The gentleman Carlos L. has had a butcher business for the past six years which he founded with the purpose of improving his income to provide better conditions to his beloved family. With great effort and dedication he has managed to get ahead and despite the unfortunate things that life presents on occasion, this gentlemen has provided for her beloved family. The reason why he has come to Ceprodel today is to receive a loan that will allow him to buy meat to sell it. It is important to highlight that this loan needs to be delivered as soon as possible to continue with the development of the business presently.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy A. is 47 years old and lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province. She runs a grocery store from her home and typically makes US$ 15 in revenue per day. Her husband, pictured with her, is a construction foreman, earning US$ 15 a day as well. This couple has two children. Mrs. Tuy would like to take out a loan to purchase more grocery products for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami F. est revendeuse de fruits et légumes au marché d’Atakpamé. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter les marchandises auprès des cultivateurs dans les fermes et les revendre aux petits détaillants. Elle espère, avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son commerce.
texts.en:
Ami F. is a retailer of fruit and vegetables at the Atakpamé marketplace. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three. Her work consists in buying merchandise from growers on farms and reselling it to small-scale retailers. She hopes to use this loan to improve the capacity of her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion is 29 years old and he is a specialist in computers. He has an internet cafe that works non-stop. Besides his job Ion has a family with a small child. He wants to have more time together with his family, to be more around his small child. He needs some money to hire a new person who will replace him at the work, even on a day and a night. Besides that new employee, he wants to purchase some parts for his computers to be more efficient, and of course the business will go better.

loans.use: hire a new employee

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as an aluminum producer for 12 years. He also repairs doors and windows. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif was born in 1967. He is married and has four children. Akif is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish village. This village was built for IDPs. Fve years ago he started a sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 20 sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Codedia

texts.en:
Codelia is 34 years old and she is married with three children. She sells baby items, such as baby nappies, lotion, and so on.

She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more baby items to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
C. Ngô Thị is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has four adult children.  To making a living, C. owns and operates an agricultural business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND (US$300), which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fourth loan she has taken out  from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora B. is from the town of Jimenez. She is 55 years old. Nora is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. has long been engaged in the hog-raising business. Since she likes pigs, this become a livelihood that supports her family's needs. She is 40 years old and she ventured into this business to support her two children, especially to give them the right education.

Now, she would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. The loan funds will also be used to buy fertilizer because she also owns a rice field a short distant from their home.

She chose CEVI for its services. In addition to the loans, she has received training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
“Hard work will make my dreams come true”--this is what Rogelia always keep in mind every day. She is busy maintaining their home and her hog-raising business. Aside from raising hogs, she also cooks homemade doughnuts and sells them in their village.  

In order to have additional capital, Rogelia decided to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000.00. She aims to generate more income from her small businesses and improve it. If given the chance, Rogelia will purchase additional piglets to raise and maintain her doughnut vending.
 
Rogelia is working hard to continuously support the education of her two children who are currently studying. She also would like to help her husband in providing the financial needs of their family, especially their daily food consumption. Her husband Valeriano is working as a farmer. They have eight children; three of them are already married, three already have stopped their studies and ended up being helpers/laborers, and two are still studying. Rogelia wishes someday that her two younger children will continue their studies and somehow gain a college degree since most of their children were not able to pursue their studies even in high school.

loans.use: additional capital for the farm and doughnut store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 55 years old and divorced with four children aged between 22 and 36 years of age. None of her children go to school. She resides and rents a one room house where she stays with five people. Mariam takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water into her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She buys charcoal from delivery trucks which get the charcoal from villages. She doesn’t incur any extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to 20 customers a day. Mariam sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the last two years.

Mariam has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for six years servicing her twelfth loan and working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal as it is getting towards the rainy season and during the rainy season rural roads becomes impassable. Mariam aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business location as well as a home. .

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
A. was born in 1960. She is happily married to Amabo Peter and has three children. She is a very hard-working young lady. She was unhappy after the death of her sister and family members due to hardship. Although she did not complete school because of lack of home training, ignorance, and especially poverty, she is still determined to succeed in life and provide for her children what her parents could not provide for her. 

She plans to invest this loan in raising chickens and cows and selling gateau, a French almond cake. She is going to provide her community with chicken meat and food for her family and community. She will also sell the manure from the chickens to cultivate vegetables and farm products. Experience has taught her how to manage a business like this one. In addition, her farm is located in a very good area. 

She will used the profit from the loan to educate her grandchildren and provide necessities and medication for them. A. loves GHAPE because of the low interest and the social interactions among members. These interactions bolster her loan use and management.   

 The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy chicken, cows, and oil

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye D. âgé de 40 ans , il s’active dans la vente de pièces détachées sur la route nationale au quartier Médine au sortir de la ville de Mbour depuis cinq (5) ans .Ce prêt lui servira a l’achat de nouveaux  produits et matériaux  de véhicule pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Il est marié, les revenus tirés de cette vente lui permettent  de faire face aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille

loans.use: achat pieces détachées

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old single man. In 2004, he decided to own a van to work as a van driver as his own business after 10 years of experience. That's how he will earn money and improve his living situation. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to change the wheels on his van to continue his work properly.

loans.use: To buy new wheels

loans.name: Kare Amandy

texts.es:
Kare Amandy G. B. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de lenceria fina, Kare fabrica las pulseras y los collares con decoracion de piedras brillantes y plata. Kare tiene un taller en el cual fabrica dichas piezas, tiene 3 personas a su cargo que le ayudan a la fabricacion de sus joyas. esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
este negocio es muy bueno ya que su producto es bien vendido, muchas mujeres ahora compran este tipo de producto por ser barato y muy bonito. 
las muchachas tambien venden el prodcuto y tienen comision por cada venta, esto hace que se venda mas el prodcuto rapido.
kare tiene dos hijos uno esta en la escuela y el otro esta pequeño, tiene que cuidarlo todo el dia. su taller queda en su casa de habitacion asi que no descuida a su hijo.
ella le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
nos comento que su meta es poder fabricar muchos collares y pulseras para distribuirlo en diferentes departamentos de nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Kare Amandy G. B. is 26 years old and has a business selling fine lingerie. She also makes bracelets and necklaces decorated with glittering stones and silver. Kare has a workshop where she employs three assistants who help her make the jewelry. These businesses are her only sources of income. Her products sell very well. Many women buy them because they are inexpensive and stylish. Her employees also sell these products and earn a commission, which means her inventory sells even more quickly.

Kare has two children. One is in school and the other one is still young, so she has to look after him all day. Her workshop is located in her home, so she is able to keep an eye on him. Her income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. Kare told us that one of her goals is to produce as many necklaces and bracelets as possible for distribution to other districts within the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, earrings, bracelets, chains, rings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay customs fees

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married. He is a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk where he offers transportation services. He started this business six years ago after he quit working as a driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family. Currently, his monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnyas.  
 
Kostya is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to finish repairs on his vehicle. He wants to paint it and possibly re-sell it to be able to buy a newer, more comfortable car for his business. Kostya works long hours to provide a decent living for his family. He has many challenges in his work. However, he admits he would never go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Мухидинов Иброхим проживает в Сарбандском районе. Возраст 38 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Иброхим имеет среднее образование, он более 11 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном торгует он овощами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ibrohim M. lives in the Sarband district. He is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Ibrohim has secondary education. He has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 11 years. Ibrohim primarily sells vegetables. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Madame Dieynaba N., agée de 51 ans, est une commerçante de légumes et poissons au marché principal de Bambey, une communauté rurale situé 100km de Dakar  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  Elle explique qu'elle a commencé le commerce en 1989, avec l'invitation de sa soeur.  Aujourd'hui, elle a son propre éventaire sous l'abris du marché.  Avec le crédit de 150,000 FCFA elle voudrait acheter des arachides, cubes Maggi (un épice) et des légumes verts.  
Madame N. est mariée et mère des enfants majeurs, mais elle est en charge de deux petits fils.
texts.en:
A 51 year-old woman, Dieynaba N. sells vegetables and fish at the main market of Bambey, a rural community located 100 km (60 miles) from Dakar. UIMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) started a loan fund in Bambey in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. Mrs. N. started her business in 1989 at the suggestion of her sister. Now she has her own stand indoors at the market. With this 150 000 CFA francs loan she would like to buy peanuts, Maggi cubes (a spice) and green vegetables. Mrs. N. is married and has adult children, but she is responsible for two male grandchildren.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladys R. tiene 27 años es otra  socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive  en la comunidad del mismo nombre con sus dos hijos de 8 y 1 año  en casa de su padre  porque es madre soltera y los niños no son reconocidos  por su progenitor, por lo que debe  contribuir con los gastos  de la casa a mas de la mantención de sus niños.

 Nuestra socia nos comenta que éste sector es muy agrícola por lo que la mayoria de su poblacion se dedica al cultivo de flores y frutas como manzanas, duraznos, claudias y a la crianza de animales y es por eso que Gladys se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos  que son vendidos en el mercado de Gualaceo

Motivada por unas amigas formó parte de éste banco y desde hace seis ciclos trabaja con la Fundación, los créditos obtenidos le han permitido sacar adelante su negocio y a sus hijos y nos comenta que el nuevo préstamo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales como hierba, maíz y vitaminas.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio poco a poco para la mantención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys R. is 27 years old and a member of “La Estancia” Communal Bank. She lives in the community also named La Estancia and has two children, ages 8 and 1. Gladys lives at home with her father because she is a single mother. Her children are not acknowledged by their biological father, who should be contributing toward child support and household expenses.

Gladys tells us she lives in a highly agricultural area where most of the population grows flowers and fruits, such as apples, peaches, and plums, as well as engages in animal husbandry. She decided to raise guinea pigs and chickens to sell at the Gualaceo Market.

Motivated by her friends, Gladys joined the Communal Bank and has now participated in six loan cycles with the Foundation. The loans have allowed her to succeed in her business and help her children get ahead. With this new loan, Gladys says she will purchase feed for her animals such as grasses, corn, and vitamins. Her goal is to grow her business over time so that she can continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric, 31 years old, manages a 1 hectare rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. He’s married and has a 5-year old child. He needs additional capital to purchase farm supplies and fertilizers. He’s requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 15,000 Philippine pesos. CEVI offers the lowest interest rate and the loan will be of great help in financing his business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Leopord

texts.en:
Leopord was born in 1982, is single, and takes care of three dependents. He lives with his parents in the Gasabo district of Kigali in the village called Remera. Leopord supports his parents which is the reason why he has to work hard in order to suppy the basic needs of his family.

Leopord owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products such as necklaces for men and women, toys for children, and so on. His business is open from six in the morning to ten in the evening every day, even during the weekend. He employs one person from the community in his shop as a helper.

Thanks to the demand, which is increasing very fast, Leopord is requesting a loan from KIva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products so that he is able to satisfy his customers. He plans to get married when the level of profits he expects to earn is reached.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a friendly and a hardworking woman who sells medicines at retail prices in Ibadan. She has been in this business for a long time and uses her years of experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to expand her business.

Esther hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a photographer and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Esther has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Petrona Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Petrona Francisca P. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio de Guadalupe, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo no tiene carga que mantener pero es una señora muy trabajadora siempre le ha gustado tener su propio negocio.
Tiene tres años de tener su negocio empezó su negocio con un capital de C$ 1,500.00 aporte de su esposo ella atiende su negocio desde la siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche diario hasta los días domingo. Este financiamiento lo solicito para surtir su negocio ya que ella tiene una demanda porque tiene una escuela de frente y vende productos escolares. Ya tiene 10 año de trabajar con Ceprodel y lleva cuatro créditos y le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio y ahora tiene otra refrigeradora y más mobiliario para su propia venta
texts.en:
Señora Petrona Francisca P. runs a corner store from her home in the Guadalupe neighbourhood. Her husband is supportive but doesn't have many responsibilites as his wife is very hardworking and has always enjoyed having her own business. Petrona has had the business for three years and started it with a $1,500 contribution from her husband. She works at the store from 7am to 9pm every day, even Sundays. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy stock for the store. There is a demand for her wares as there is a school opposite, and she sells school supplies. She has already worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel for 10 years and has had four loans which have helped her improve her business. She now has another refrigerator and more fittings for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
C’est ainsi que le sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°4  est composé de Madame Fatoumata T.  la présidente, Madame Aïssatou W. trésorière, toutes deux vendeuses de tissus, de Madame Rokhaya F. vendeuse de légumes, Madame Aminata D. et Madame Ndeye  Khady D. qui vendent respectivement des poissons fumés et des poissons séchés.Madame la présidente Fatoumata T. commerce le tissu wax et basin depuis 6 ans. Elle s'approvisionne en dehors du Sénégal en Rosso à la Mauritanie. De temps en temps, Madame T. diversifie son commerce avec l'achat et la vente d'arachide grillé dans son quartier à Grand Thiès. Agée de 42 ans, Madame Fatoumata T. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 13 ans, 8 ans et 5 ans.
texts.en:
As its name suggests, Femmes Commerçantes is a network of businesswomen, It is based at Grand Thiès and was created in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, its current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by Oxfam at Thiès, in which she became familiar with group organization and running a business. The members of the group are dedicated to what they do, and meet together once a month. Over and above membership dues, each of them pays 200 FCFA a month into a group operating fund. Looking for financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. The network is divided into 19 subgroups of five people so that financing can be better handled. Each subgroup has its own president and treasurer. They now seek, for the second time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA per member or 500,000 FCFA for each subgroup, to grow their various activities. The members repay their loans to the president and the treasurer, Ms. Coumba Seck. They, in turn, are responsible for repaying U-IMCEC. According to the president, the group’s praiseworthy objective is to fight family poverty. The subgroup Femmes Commerçantes N° 4 consists of the president Ms. Fatoumata T., the treasurer Ms. Aïssatou W. (both retailers of clothing fabric), Ms. Rokhaya F. a vendor of vegetables, Ms. Aminata D. who sells smoked fish, and Ms. Ndeye Khady D. who sells dried fish. The president Fatoumata T. has been selling Wax and Basin types of clothing fabric for the past six years. She gets her supplies outside Senegal, from Rosso in Mauritania. From time to time she varies her business by retailing roasted peanuts in her neighborhood in Grand Thiès. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children aged 13, 8, and 5 years.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: get supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: Monsieur Libasse S. est un jeune tailleur de 27 ans. Il habite a camberene et est membre de la caisse depuis avril 2009. Il gere un atalier de couture non loin de la caisse de camberene. Il a fait l'apprentissage de la couture pendant plusieurs annees. Et c'est depuis 5 ans qu'il a ouvert son propre atelier. Il emprunte 150 000 frs pour acheter une machine a coudre. Ce credit lui permettra donc d'accroitre la productivite de son activite et de reduire la duree d'attente de sa lientele pour recevoir leurs commandes.
texts.en: Mr. Libasse S. is a young tailor aged 27. He lives in Camberne and is a member of the bank since April 2009. He maintains a studio close to the branch office. Before opening his studio 5 years ago, he was an apprentice tailor for several years. He is borrowing 150,000 francs in order to buy a new sewing machine. This loan will help him increase his productivity and reduce the amount of time his clients have to wait before receiving their orders.

loans.use: achat de machine a coudre

loans.name: Fatima Aracely

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para poder ahorrar y poder comprar su propio terreno y lograr hacer su propia casa ya que viven en casa de su mama, ya que no cuentan con el dinero para comenzar a construir. Su esposo trabaja en reparación de teléfonos celulares, y ella se dedica al comercio venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace varios años el cual comenzó con dinero que su  esposo dio, y financiamientos con otra institución.
Su meta es poder alcanzar ventas alta, captación de clientes nuevos, lo cual invertirá en ropa para dama, caballero, niño y cosmético en variedad para lograr mejores utilidades que beneficien en su hogar.
texts.en:
Fatima is 29 years old with a a four-year old son. She and her husband work very hard to save money to buy land and have their own house because they currently live in her mother's house. They still do not have enough saved to start construction. Her husband works repairing cell phones, and she works selling clothing and cosmetics. She started this business several years ago with money that her husband and other financial institutions provided. Her goal is to increase her sales and gain new clientele. She will use the loan to purchase clothing for women, men, and children as well as a variety of cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Lucelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lucelina es socia muy activa del banco comunal Alfa, desde hace 2 ciclos está trabajando con la Fundación con los créditos y su negocio ha ido incrementando.

La señora Lucelina está comprometida,  la actividad que realiza es la venta de pescado por libras,  tiene un puesto en el mercado central  de la  ciudad de Portoviejo compra por gaveta en un puerto pesquero de la provincia de Manabí, este en un sitio donde llegan las embarcaciones y se comercializa el pescado para diferentes partes del país, este negocio lo mantienen el esposo de nuestra socia desde hace 27 años.

 La señora Lucelina se dedica en los momentos que le quedan libre a pintar uñas y desde hace 6 meses a vender productos naturales; ella cuenta con sus clientes fijos que le llaman para hacer los pedidos, por el momento nuestra socia tiene que dejar de salir a recorrer porque se le ha presentado un problema  salud, pero desde su casa estará atendiendo.

  Estos esposos son muy trabajadores,han pensado con este crédito invertir en un nuevo negocio, que seria una mini granja para pollos, sin dejar la venta de  pescado, con una parte del crédito tendrán que invertir en comprar las vitaminas, los alimentos y todo que se necesita para empezar con el negocio.
texts.en:
Lucelina is a very active member of the Alfa communal bank. She has been working with the Foundation for 2 loan cycles and her business has been growing. Lucelina is very involved in her business. She sells fish by the pound. She has a place in the central market in the city of Portoviejo. She buys by the container in a fishing port in the province of Manabí. This is a place where fishing boats dock and sell their fish, destined for different parts of the country. Her husband has been in this business for 27 years. Lucelina works doing manicures in her free time, and for 6 months she has been selling natural products. She has regular customers who call her to place orders. For the moment she has to give up leaving the house to work because she has a health problem, but she will tend to her business from her home. This couple is very hard working. They plan to invest this loan in a new business, which will be a small chicken farm (without abandoning the fish business). With part of the loan they will have to buy vitamins, feed, and everything that they will need to start the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed, medicines

loans.name: Chhoa

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoa P., 59, is a village consultant advisor who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap province in Cambodia. He was married to his wife many years ago. He has five children and all five are now married and have already started new homes. All of his children are employed in different jobs.

Chhoa P. owns a machine that he uses to provide a milling service for farmers for a fee. He has another financial earner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She raises a few pigs in a pigpen they built next to their house. In a day the family is typically able to make around $10 to control the financial problems of their family.

As the pig-raising trade is a very profitable one for his family, Chhoa P. is applying for a loan to purchase many piglets for their stall.

loans.use: To purchase many piglets for their stall

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly Y. is a villager in Spueu village in Takeo province and she was born in 1974. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mom Srey, is a construction worker who can also earn some money to support his family. They try to work a lot but they can only earn a little income. 

So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Ly Y. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and pig feed for breeding pigs to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is attending local public school, while the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig feed for breeding pig

loans.name: Maame Yaa

texts.en:
Maame Yaa A. is single and has received senior high education. She bakes meat pies and rock cakes to sell in Abura.

Maame Yaa has been in this business for four years and takes care of herself with the little profits she makes from her business. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake goods to distribute to her customers and to new ones who want to order from her.

Maame Yaa hopes to reinvest into her business should there be any increase in profit.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Plan Your Future Group

texts.en:
Cynthia A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Plan Your Future”. She is 32 years old and is married with four children who range from 7 to 12 years old. Cynthia was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.

For three years, Cynthia has been selling cosmetics in Logan Town Market on Bushrod Island, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 35,500 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Cynthia’s goal is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Manuela; ella tiene 59 años de edad y la socia es conviviente,  ella tiene 3 hijos, La socia a administrar su agencia de viajes, la socia es dueña de la agencia de viajes y turismo Cusco - Maravilla del Mundo; desde el año 2006, La socia se dedica a comprar mediante pre pagos los boletos de tren, también, los hoteles y restaurantes; Ella solicita el préstamo para pagar sus pre pagos en los diferentes servicios. 

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "DINAMICO" ("Dynamic") communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Manuela. She is 59 years old and lives with her partner. She has 3 children and manages a travel agency. She is the owner of the "Maravilla del Mundo" ("Wonder of the World") Cusco travel and tourism agency. Since 2006, she has worked buying pre-paid train tickets, hotel rooms, and restaurant meals. She is requesting this loan to pre-pay for these different services. This borrower values and is grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will allow her to grow and to have a better quality of life. She also promises to comply with the repayment of her loan according to the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pre-pay for various travel services (train tickets, hotel rooms, and restaurant meals)

loans.name: Manuela Modesta

texts.es: Manuela es de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y dos mujeres, es tejedora, en la actividad tiene más de 5 años de experiencia, solicita su segundo crédito para remodelación de vivienda, efectivamente este financiamiento no es rentable, pero si tiende a satisfacer la necesidad de la solicitante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El préstamo anterior lo pago sin problemas de atraso.
texts.en:
Manuela is 46 years old, married and has a son and two daughters. She is a weaver and has more than five years of experience in the trade. She is requesting her second loan to remodel her home. Effectively, the loan isn't a profitable one, but it will satisfy Manuela's needs and improve her quality of life. She paid her previous loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel home

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. sells secondhand bedsheets and towels at Elmina. She has no educational background.

Ekua is divorced and has two children. She provides all the needs of her family.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy a bale of bedsheets and towels to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a bale of bedsheets and towels to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Lourdes is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Lourdes is also a Natasha dealer. She hopes to acquire more Natasha products that she could sell to their community.

Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and acquire Natasha products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and acquire Natasha products

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya where he has been farming for the last 30 years. He has employed one farmhand from his community. His farm produces milk, maize and beans which he sells locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family. 

Stephen has requested this loan of 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The increased income from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his children and their nutrition will be taken care of. He faces the challenges of diseases which is too costly to treat and the high cost of animal feeds. He however intends to expand his farming in the future by buying a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn him more income.

Stephen is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are between the ages of 1 and 32. Five of the children are currently attending school. He is happy to have joined Juhudi and wishes that Juhudi could organize seminars for them.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Las Muñequitas Mineras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Muñequitas Mineras, porque viven cerca de las minas ubicadas a la salida del corredor turístico. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Pachuca, perteneciente al municipio de Mineral de la Reforma en Hidalgo.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. La Sra. Lucia C. es integrante del grupo, tiene 44 años y cuatro hijos de 13, 14, 11 y 7 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de servilletas (bordadas y tejidas) para amigos, conocidos y cumpleaños. Comenta que quiere su préstamo para invertir en insumos para el negocio. Su deseo más grande en la vida es poder darles a sus hijos estudios para que sobresalgan en la vida.La Sra. Olivia Melina T., también integrante del grupo, tiene 34 años, tiene un dependiente económico, vende chalupas y pambazos, alas y patas de pollo preparadas, tiene su puesto afuera de su casa  y vende los viernes, sábados y domingos. Ella trabaja para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, le gustaría irse de vacaciones con todos sus hijos y pasar un lindo momento. 

La señora Adela Martínez al momento de tomarse la foto se movio.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Muñequitas Mineras” (The Little Mining Bracelets) because they live near the mines that lie along a tourist corridor. The members are from the city of Pachuca, which is part of the municipality of Mineral de la Reforma in the State of Hidalgo. This group consists of eleven members. Sra. Lucia C. is one of the group members. She is 44 years old and has four children (ages 13, 14, 11, and 7). Lucia produces and sells napkins (both embroidered and woven) for friends, acquaintances, and birthdays. She says she wants to invest her loan in supplies for her business. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide her children with an education so that they can get ahead in life.

Sra. Olivia Melina T. is also a member of the group. She is 34 years old and has one financial dependent. Olivia sells chalupas, Mexican bread, and chicken legs and wings from a stand outside of her house. She sells on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Olivia works in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys going on vacation with all of her children and having a beautiful time.

Sra. Adela Martínez was moving when this photograph was taken.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is very happy and feels very excited about the support that she received from Kiva lenders for her previous loan. She prays that they all will be blessed. She has a good relationship with the institution.

Now, Melanie is requesting another Kiva loan to continue her buy-and-sell secondhand appliances business. She has been able to improve her business due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva supporters.

She discovered the huge impact the loan has made on her family as, with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired needs and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI. She is also happy because she is able to eat well and help her husband to meet the needs of the family. 

Melanie hopes that their business will continue to succeed because this has been their life, providing for their family for more than eleven years now. They love what they do.

Melanie’s business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is joy to see fulfillment in her business and family and, with her six children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life someday.

She prays that her business will continue to succeed so that she will be able to send all of her children to school until they complete college. She promises ASHI that she will work hard so that the chances that they give her will never be wasted.

loans.use: to support her secondhand appliances business

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Edith Betty R. D. M., 43 años D. edad, casada y con 2 hijos; integra el comitè como tesorera del AlCOM: "Nuestra Señora D. Guadalupe".(En la foto, Edith viste D. pantalon verD. y compra color marron, esta sentada y es la primera D. la derecha).
Edith se inició en el negocio hace 07 años, ella nunca pensó llegar a ser negociante ya que su esposo trabaja como policia y dependían D. un sueldo. Ella empezò este negocio ya que sus hijas estaban ingresando a estudios secundarios y a la vez necesitaban ampliar y seguir construyendo su casa, ya que vivian en una casa alquilada.
Fue duro iniciar a ser negociante ya que ella nunca había trabajado, primero fue con la venta D. ropa y cosméticos a domicilio; pero en cada època D. fiestas optó por cambiar D. giro D. negocio D. acuerdo a la estación; en campaña escolar venD. ambulatoriamente útiles escolares, en fiestas naviD.ñas venD. panetones, champagne y conservas, pero tambien mantiene su rubro D. venta D. ropa ya que esas cobranzas las hace semanalmente, ella actualmente necesita trabajar mas, ya que su esposo se encuentra con descanso médico por una temporada D. 6 meses, debido a una fractura en la rodilla, y debido a este accidente, ya no percibe los ingresos D. su sueldo como antes. Ahora su fortaleza para seguir adelante es poder seguir educando a sus hijas para que ellas sean profesionales y la vez les pueda ofrecer un mejor hogar adquiriendo mas cosas para sus necesidades. Su esposo actualmente le está ayudando con el cuidado D. sus hijas y ella pueD. salir a trabajar mientras él se recupera.

El prèstamo adquirido es para ampliar su linea D. venta en esta navidad, adicionando a la venta D. panetones, comprar chapagne y conservas.
texts.en:
Edith Betty R. D. M. is 43 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She is the treasurer of the “Nuestra Señora D. Guadalupe” (Our Lady of Guadalupe) community bank.  In the photo Edith is the lady wearing green pants and brown sweater.  She is sitting down on the far right.

Edith started her business 7 years ago.  She never thought about becoming a saleswoman since her husband was a policeman and they managed with just his wage.  However, Edith started her business because her daughters were beginning their secondary education and she needed to extend and continue building their home since they lived in a rented house.

It was difficult for Edith to start out as a saleswoman since she had never worked before.  First she started selling clothes and cosmetics in her home but every holiday season she decided to change her business direction according to the season.  During the back-to-school season she sells school materials itinerantly and during the Christmas period she sells panettones, champagne and canned foods.  However, she still works in her clothes sales business since it provides a weekly income.

Edith currently needs to work more since her husband is off work sick for 6 months as he fractured his knee.  Owing to the accident, he is no longer bringing in as much money as he used to.  Now Edith's strength to keep going comes from the need to continue educating her daughters so that they become professionals and the need to be able to offer them a better home, acquiring more things they need.  Her husband is currently helping her to look after their daughters and she can now go out to work while he gets better.

Edith's loan will be used to extend her sales line this Christmas, adding to her sales of panettones by buying champagne and canned food.

loans.use: To add merchandise to diversify her sales

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely L. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 31 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Ely owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ely has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Ely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en: Cyprian M. is 37 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He runs a barber shop at Kagundo. Cyprian was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.  Cyprian has been running this business for 10 years and his monthly profit is 10,000 KES. This 30,000 KES loan is Cyprian's fourth loan from KADET LTD and his previous loans were paid on time. He intends to use the loan to buy new shaving machines, chemicals, and towels. If this loan boosts the business Cyprian will pay school fees and buy food for his children.  He dreams of having a big barber shop and he describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy new shaving machines, chemicals, and towels

loans.name: Pinina Armandina

texts.es: Pinina es una señora muy alegre, trabajadora es positiva y emprendedora. Ella a sus 34 años de edad está logrando sus objetivos poco a poco. Tiene una pequeña bodeguita en su casa desde hace 10 años, con los ingresos de este pequeño negocio logró mejorar el ambiente de su bodega, parte de estos ingresos lo utiliza para pagar los gastos de la casa  y la educación de sus dos hijos quienes aún son menores de edad. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, leche, pollo, verduras) para su bodega. A Pinina le gustaría comprarse una combi para transporte público y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pinina is a very cheerful, hard-working, positive and enterprising lady.  She is 34 years old and is gradually achieving her goals in life.

Pinina has a small grocery store in her home which she has had for 10 years.  She has used the profits from this small business to improve the store's environment.  She uses part of her profits to cover her household expenses and to pay for the education of her two children who are still dependent on her.

Pinina requested this loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, chicken, vegetables) for her store.  She would like to buy a van for providing public transport and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, chicken and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Pendeza Group

texts.fr: Tembeya R. Antoinnette  est entrepreneur, trésorière du groupe, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 2 enfants etudient, 2 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et 2 autres ont leurs propres foyers.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette    est vendeuse des  tomates, arachides, légumes, oignons, etc. au marchee sectoriel de Ndosho. Elle  commença ce business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Avant de joindre cette activité, jadis, elle vendait les divers dans un kiosque. Son capital d’affaire initial fut 30$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (2 paniers de tomates, 50 kg d’arachides, etc.) et  ajouter un nouveau produits celui de vente poisson, qu’elle veut également entreprendre pour diversifie son business.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire et laisser la vie de locataire. La cliente Tembeya R. Antoinnette  remercie Hekima pour  ses crédits sans relance en faveur de pauvres. Le groupe Pendeza est constitué de 32 membres.
texts.en: Tembeya R. Antoinnette is an entrepreneur and she is the treasurer of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. Two of her children are in school, 2 are not going to school for the lack of financial resources, and 2 have their own homes. Her husband is unemployed. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is a merchant who sells tomatoes, peanuts, vegetables, onions etc, at in the sector's market of Ndosho. She started her business with her own money, which she received from her husband. Prior to the business she has currently, she sold various merchandise from a kiosk. Her start up capital funds was $30. In early 2010, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) amounting to $50. This new loan will be used to purchase more products (2 baskets of tomatoes, 50Kg of peanuts, etc.) and to add new products for resale, including fish, and to diversify her business. In addition she would like to purchase a parcel of land where to build a life as a homeowner. Tembeya R. Antoinnette is thankful to Hekima for the loans granted to the poor. The group Pendeza is made up of 32 members.

loans.use: To purchase 2 baskets of tomatoes, 50kg of peanuts, and fish.

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Hjugua Hu de la ciudad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Rilcy Y., ella es una mujer muy correcta, honesta y trabajadora, Doña Rilcy viven con su marido, que también tiene un pequeño negocio, y sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres van a la escuela.
La Sra. Rilcy sale todos los días con su pequeño catálogo a ofrecer sus joyas, recorre varios barrios de Caacupé y también ciudades cercanas para vender sus productos.
Gracias a este programa ella cuenta con un pequeño capital para poder tener más productos para la venta y así poder generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Ella y todas sus compañeras del comité están muy contentas y agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo que les brinda através del Programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
texts.en: The women of the present committee are from the Hjugua company in the city of Caacupé.  The committee's president is Mrs. Rilcy Y..  She is an upstanding, honest, hard-working woman who lives with her husband, who also has a small-business, and her four children who are in school.  Mrs. Rilcy goes out everyday with her small catalog to sell jewelery.  She goes to various neighborhoods in Caacupé and also nearby cities to sell her products.  Thanks to this program, she can count on some capital so she can have more products to sell and generate more income for her and her family.  She, and all her friends in the group are very happy and grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they provide through the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras."

loans.use: To purchase earrings, bracelets, chains, medals, rings.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira S.  lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 45 years old and has two children. Elmira graduated from the Textile University in Ukraine as a production engineer. She is known as a very communicative and responsive person.

To find a means of subsistence for her family and help her husband to cover the family’s expenses, Elmira started her business in selling women’s clothes and trousers, using her start-up capital of 40,000 KGS. Year in and year out, she managed to broaden her business by widening her assortment of goods.  She also paid for the education of her daughter in China
  
But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Elmira lost her business, which was robbed and looted. Her husband, who supported and helped her in all activities, was injured in a shootout during the clashes and died.  This tragedy became a hard blow for Elmira’s family and children.

However, Elmira isn't giving up.  She is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Elmira is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business selling women's clothes. She plans to rent a selling point at the local market.  With the revenues she anticipates from the business, she plans to pay for education for her son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, leading to increased employment and meeting the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel S. D. L., D. treinta y tres años D. edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad que estudian y esposo en municipio y departamento D. La Libertad, Reina posee desD. hace mas D. 10 años un puesto en el muelle del Puerto D. La Libertad, lugar que es prácticamente una plaza D. venta D. mariscos y en el que ella cuenta con mucha clientela local y externa. Todos los días es su esposo Don René quien se encarga D. suministrar el pescado que venD. Reina, es decir, él es pescador artesanal, le lleva varios tipos D. pescado: boca colorada, mojarra, curvina, lonja, caite, camarón, jaiba, entre otros. Es preferida por lo fresco D. sus mariscos y ahora sus clientes están empezando a encargarle el acostumbrado pescado seco usado para tortas D. pescado, es por ello que necesita D. este crédito y poder suplir la necesidad D. sus clientes y obtener con ello ganancias para estos próximos días D. temporada D. verano.-
texts.en:
Reina Isabel S. D. L., age 33, lives with her three young children, who attend school, and her husband in the municipality and department of La Libertad. For more than 10 years, Reina has had a stall in the harbor area of Puerto D. la Libertad, a place that, for all practical purposes, is a plaza for selling seafood. She has a lot of customers from close by and further away.

Every day, her husband, Don René, supplies the fish that Reina sells. He fishes by hand catching several types of fish: red snapper, sunfish, sea bass, lonja, mackerel, shrimp, and crabs, among others.

She is preferred because of the freshness of her seafood and now her customers are beginning to order custom dried fish used for fish cakes. She needs this loan in order to be able to meet the needs of her customers and to obtain earnings for the upcoming summer season.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for the summer season.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 34 years. She has 5 children who are between the ages of 3 and 5. Her husband sells different kinds of merchandise. Alphonsine owns a shop in which she sells different food stuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Alphonsine is requesting a loan to buy more items and fill her shop and make more profits. She plans to pay her children school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry Odera N. is 30 years old and married to Tabitha who is a business lady. He supports four people. Henry runs a motorcycle transport business in Nyatike, Migori town. He has been in this business for 16 years and earns a good income.     


He learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy another motorbike for the business.              


Henry intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for his children.  In future he plans to grow his business and be able to manage many motorbikes for hire.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga M. es la Directora General de este comité, la misma se dedica a la venta de ropas y perfumes, ella es soltera y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, es la única que genera ingresos en su hogar y por tal motivo sería de mucha utilidad para ella y su familia el crédito que solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, ya que lo destinaría en su totalidad a la compra de mercaderías para la venta, como perfumes y colonias.
Este grupo del Barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnacion, surgió por contacto de las señoras  con la Fundación Paraguaya, el grupo se encuentra en el 2º ciclo, opera con la institución desde el año 2010.
Todas las mujeres son personas muy trabajadoras, luchan cada día contra todos los obstáculos que puedan tener para sobresalir, pues desean con mucha fe sacar adelante a sus familias, haceles progresar y superar la pobreza que últimamente se ha vuelto un mal generalizado en muchos sectores de nuestro país.
Las integrantes poseen muy buenas referencias crediticias, por lo que han obtenido la confianza de esta fundación en varias ocasiones, y esperan contar con la misma confianza de Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is from the San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Encarnacion. It came about thanks to the contact that its members had with Fundación Paraguaya; the group is now in its 2nd loan cycle and has been with Fundación Paraguaya since 2010.

Olga M. is the director of this group. She makes her living selling clothing and perfume; she is single and has two small children. Olga is the only breadwinner in her household so the loan she is seeking from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva would be very useful to her and her family. She will use the loan to purchase an inventory of merchandise, such as perfume and cologne.

All the women in the group are very hardworking people; they struggle every day against all the obstacles so that they could get ahead and have an earnest desire to help their families move forward, to make progress, to overcome the poverty that has recently become a general scourge in many parts of our country.

The members have very good credit references as they have earned the trust of this foundation on several occasions; they hope to be able to have the same level of trust with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and cologne

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more beauty supplies for her cosmetics sales business. Merlinda has been in this business for 12 years. Merlinda earns additional income selling RTW [Ready To Wear] clothing.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty supplies to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City.  He is 48 years old. Jimmy is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and necessities needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & necessities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transport business for the past seventeen years. She also farms sugarcane, has a general store and fattens pigs.

Agnes has been sustaining her businesses through her own effort and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

Agnes dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eleuterio Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio,  es soltero pero tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores es por ello que no están a su cargo, vive en casa propia que logro construir con mucho esfuerzo, Eleuterio se dedica a arreglar bicicletas brindando mantenimiento a las mismas , empezó a realizar esta actividad en un local pequeño, pero con el correr del tiempo ya tiene un local mas amplio, Eleuterio es muy conocido en la zona, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en  comprar materiales  como ladrillos, arena, cemento, fierro, para el techado de su casa y otra parte para pagarle al albañil , su sueño en el futuro es terminar de construir su casa con acabados para tener una mejor calidad de vida, Eleuterio esta muy agradecido con la confianza que le estamos brindando.
texts.en: Señor Eleuterio is unmarried but he has 2 children who are grown so they are not in his care.  He lives in his own home which he managed to build with much effort.   Eleuterio's occupation is providing maintenance for bicycles and fixing them.  He began this activity in a small way, but over time he has expanded it.  Eleuterio is well known in the area.  The loan will be invested in purchasing materials such as bricks, sand, cement, and iron for the roof and other parts of his home and to pay the builder.  His dream for the future is to finish building his house to have a better quality of life.  Eleuterio is very grateful for the confidence in him that we are providing.

loans.use: to improve his home and purchase sand, cement and iron for the roof of his home

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for four years and earns additional income from buying & selling fruit.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en: Umedjon is married and has two children. He's been working as a taxi driver for four years. Umedjon would like a loan of 9,000 somoni to help purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He likes being independent and is a real go-getter. Umedjon wanted to start his own business and he achieved his goal. Now, as he sets new goals for the future, he is hoping that additional financial assistance will help him grow business-wise and become self-sustainable and successful. ====================================== More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.
