Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Wiphala Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Wipala en un grupo de mujeres, que fueron conformadas hace seis meses atrás por la señora  Margarita rodrigues, quien actualmente es la presidenta, ella indica que por la necesidad de obtener ingresos se animo a formar un grupo y así poder acceder a un préstamo.
La mayoría de las integrantes tienen negocios pequeños como ser costura de deportivos, elaboración de masitas, tejidos y otros. Ellas destinaran el préstamo a la compra de tela, harina y lana (dependiendo del caso).
texts.en:
The Wiphala group is comprised of women who came together under the leadership of Margarita R., their current group president, six months ago. Margarita states that she decided to form this group and request a loan out of the need to earn a living.

Most of the group members have small businesses, such as a sporting apparel factory, making masitas (pastries), weaving, and other businesses. They will use this loan to purchase fabric, flour, and wool (depending on what type of business they have).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San R., 48, is a village woman living in Pursat Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works as a military policeman in the village. San R. now has four children, three of whom are of school-aged and the other one is married and lives independently.

In the past five years, San R. has faced difficulty with plowing, because she has no water buffalo. Now, she is applying for a loan to purchase a water buffalo in order to facilitate plowing the farmland during this rice-growing season.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo in order to plow her farmland

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa Del Carmen S. D. C. vive en el municipio D. Tacachico en el departamento D. La Libertad en la zona occidental del país. A sus 40 años D. edad, Teresa es responsable y madre D. tres hijos, todos menores D. edad y todos estudiantes D. educación básica. Desafortunadamente Teresa no logra pasar todo el tiempo que quisiera con sus hijos, pues tiene que trabajar largas horas diarias para poder mantener su casa y familia. Teresa solicita un préstamo para compra D. materia prima para surtir su negocio en productos lácteos, quesos y crema, que es el medio D. manutención D. la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa Del Carmen S. D. C. lives in the town of Tacachico in the eastern Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad. Teresa, 40, is a caring mother of three children, all still living at home and all still in school. Unfortunately, Teresa isn't able to spend as much time with her children as she would like because she has to work long hours every day to support them. Teresa is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies to stock her dairy, cheese and cream business, the means of support for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for dairy business.

loans.name: Navales

texts.en:
Navales R. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Navales is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Navales grows crops, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Navales has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Navales joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Navales is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Navales from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand and improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business of growing and selling flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockpiling maize

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Luisa es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Luisa venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijas.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.
Los sueños D. Luisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.

loans.name: Ogiesoba

texts.en: F. is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She sells yams and other foodstuffs very close to her house.   She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia D. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling shampoo, soap and candies in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Clemencia has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2007, Clemencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improve and expand her business. Clemencia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santo Milagro

texts.es:
la señora Santo Milagro Almandares vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos, los tres estan en el colegio. el compañero de hogar don luciano se dedica a la pesca, tiene su propio equipo de pesca. el le trae el pescado y Santo lo vende en la casa a los compradores de la zona.
y tambien viaja a la capital para terminar de venderlo, vende aproximadamente Lps. 20,000.00 quincenales, su casa es muy bonita ademas vende frescos y otros productos en su casa
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar camarones que tiene encargado en tegucigalpa.
texts.en:
Señora Santo Milagro Almandares lives with a partner, and has 3 children who are in school. Her partner Don Luciano is a fisherman and has his own fishing equipment. He brings her the fish, and Santo sells it in the homes of buyers who are in the area. She also travels to the capital to make the sales; she sells approximately Lps.20,000.00 every two weeks. In addition, she sells drinks and other products from her house, which is very nice. She is requesting a loan to buy shrimp that she has on order in Tegucigalpa.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shrimp

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora  Celestina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito y Provincia de Azangaro es  casada y madre de 04 hijos, tiene 52 años de edad y viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, estudió hasta el cuarto grado de Primaria.

Celestina se dedica a la confección de  tejidos a punto, con el cual  trabaja y puede apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando. Al mismo tiempo trabaja por las tardes en el Terminal de Azangaro.

El primer préstamo que solicito fue de S/. 500.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de lana de diversos colores y materiales para poder seguir trabajando.

Ella requiere un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de  productos como: lana de alpaca, para poder seguir tejiendo y vender sus productos en estas fiestas navideñas. 

Su mayor sueño es  que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que  mas le gusta  de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas que dan.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” Communal Bank in the district and province of Azangaro. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for one year, and has a fourth-grade education. Celestina earns a living making knitted handicrafts, which helps her to support her children, who are currently in school. At the same time, she also works at the Azangaro bus terminal in the afternoons. The first loan that she requested was for 500.00 soles, which she invested in the purchase of several colors of wool and materials so that she could keep working. She now needs a loan of 1000.00 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of products such as alpaca wool—this will allow her to keep knitting and selling her products during the Christmas season. Celestina’s big dream is for her children to become professionals. She likes her communal bank because of the punctuality and because of the lectures that are given there.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool, dye, etc.

loans.name: Thank You Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. She is a food vendor. Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called Thank You. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Elizabeth, the group leader is first from right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Napo Mariama

texts.en:
Napo Mariam T. has 20 years of experience selling clothing and supplies for babies. She lives in the Agoé region of Togo, and works in the Agoé market. She is married and has six children.

This will be Mrs. T.'s first loan with WAGES, and it will be used to purchase children’s outfits and shoes in the Grand Marché to replenish her supply. This loan will help support her growing business and help her provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Rosa G. vive en casa propia D. adobe revestido junto a su esposo, dos hijas menores en edad escolar y una mayor que realiza estudios superiores en el distrito D. Santiago - Ica. Actualmente labora como obrera D. planta en una empresa Agroexportadora, y su esposo como supervisor D. campo en un fundo agrícola D. la zona. Sus excedentes son derivados en inversión para construcción D. su casa D. adobe y educación para sus hijas. Poseen bienes que han adquirido con sus ahorros. Requieren financiamiento para realizar construcción D. adobe en terreno que tienen anexo a su domicilio. Su mayor sueño  es lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales y lograr una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa G. lives in her own home maD. of adobe together with her husband, two school age daughters, and a grown daughter who is in college in the Santiago - Ica district. She currently works as a laborer in an agro-exporting company and her husband works as a supervisor in the field of an agricultural estate in the area. The money left is invested in the construction of their adobe house and in their daughters' education. They own property they have acquired through their savings. The require financing to build in the plot they have by their home. Their greatest dream is to ensure that their daughters become professionals and achieve a better quality of life for their family. They both thank the support we can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving their house

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar D. est un jeune commerçant de 35 ans qui est spécialisé dans l’habillement et la vente de sachets en plastique. Il évolue dans ce domaine depuis  l’année 2000.C’est par l’intermédiaire de ses parents qu’il a choisi cette activité surtout dans le but de gagner sa vie. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de pantalons jean, de tee-shirt et de chemise dans l’espoir d’augmenter ses gains et améliorer la situation de sa famille dont il constitue le principal soutien. Monsieur D. est sociétaire de la caisse de yoff depuis octobre 2007. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Il est père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 3 ans.
texts.en:
Mr Omar D. is a young merchant of 35 years who specializes in the sale of clothing and plastic bags. He has been operating in this domain since 2000. He chose this activity through his parents mostly in the objective to make a living. He is requesting a 500,000 francs loan to bolster his stock of denim trousers, T-shirts and shirts. He hopes to increase his benefits and to improve the situation of his family, for whom he is the main provider. Mr D. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since October 2007. He already benefited from a prior loan. He is the father of two children aged one and three.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen loves clothes and that is why she sells used clothes to make a living in Sapele, Delta state. She loves this business because she has the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has 3 children and she is happy that they are excelling in school. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports the home. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her business. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells "pap" (ground maize that is soaked and softened into a porridge) from her home. She buys maize in bulk and processes it into pap. She sells the pap to big buyers, who sell it with bean cakes, because people in this locality cherish pap and bean cakes for their breakfast. She gets her maize directly from the farmers. When corn becomes scarce, she travels far to make sure her customers are supplied. She has been in this business for eleven years.

Grace is 40 years old and a widow. She has three children whose age ranges between 12 to 21 years. With part of her profit, she is able to clothe, feed, and pay the school fees of her two younger children who are still in secondary school.

Grace is requesting for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase maize in bulk to make pap to sell. She says "thank you" and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Elsa Maribel

texts.es: Elsa, de 40 años, es separada y vive en la casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hijos menores.Tras haberse separado de su esposo  trabajó en diversos oficios, pero en vista que estaba descuidando la crianza de sus hijos pensó en dedicarse a la venta de gaseosas y helados, en el primer piso que su madre le cedió. Ya lleva quince años en el negocio y se siente a gusto. En la actualidad  vende también cervezas, en gran cantidad durante  los fines de semana, ya que durante este  tiempo se hizo muy  conocida por sus vecinos, y gracias a ellos su negocio le genera buenas ganancias. Esta muy motivada en  seguir trabajando y tiene planeado, para los meses siguientes, ingresar al bordado de chompas, por la invitación de una vecina, ya que realizaría esta labor  mientras atiende su negocio. Para más  adelante, anhela instalar en su amplio local, unas cabinas de Internet, para empezar en el negocio de alquiler de internet.Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y se compromete a  pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, como lo ha venido haciendo. Además se lleva muy bien con las compañeras de su banco comunal ya que dice son muy responsables y trabajadoras.Elsa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de varias cajas de cervezas,  y otra parte la invertirá en comprar cantidad de  hilos, de varios colores, para iniciarse en el bordado de chompas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, is separated from her husband, and lives in a house with her mother and her two minor children. Since she has separated from her husband she has worked in several offices. She saw that she was neglecting the upbringing of her children. So she decided to work selling sodas and ice cream from the first floor of her mother’s house. She has worked for fifteen years in this business and she has enjoyed it. Actually, she also sells beer. The largest quantities of beer sales are during the weekends. She is well known to her neighbors and thanks to them her business has generated a good income. She is very motivated to continue working. In the upcoming months she is going to begin to knit sweaters. Her neighbor, who knits, invited her to join her in this work. She can knit while she works in her store. In the future she would like to install booths with Internet access in her large location. She would like to sell time on the Internet. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she promises to punctually pay all her payments as she has done in the past. Also, she is well regarded by the other members of the community bank who are very responsible and very hard working. Elsa would like to purchase cases of beer with part of this loan and with the other part she would like to buy yarn in many colors in order to begin knitting sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy many cases of beer

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Tambo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Tambo, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son del Distrito de Tambo, la población se dedica a la ganadería y otras actividades comerciales.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comida, abarrotes en general, cereales, animales, crianza de animales.
Como es el Caso de la Señora Clementina que es conviviente, tiene 5 hijos, Clementina se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, produce leche y queso, además Clementina compra quesos de sus vecinos, todos los productos los vende en la costa, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra de quesos. Los sueños de Clementina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ica.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 100 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 3,800 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Tambo Communal Bank began its first loan cycle with 10 members, all from the District of Tambo. The local population is dedicated to cattle raising and other commercial activities. The members are involved in different businesses, including selling meals, general groceries, and raising cereals and animals. A typical case is Mrs. Clementina who lives with her common law partner and has 5 children. Clementina raises cattle and produces milk and cheese. In addition, she buys cheese from her neighbors and sells these products along the coast. Her loan will be invested in buying cheese. Clementina dreams that her children will become professionals, and of buying a house in the city of Ica. The members need different loan amounts, such as 100 sols, 300 sols, 600 sols, for a total of 3,800 sols in loans for this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CHEESES TO SELL

loans.name: Rizaldy

texts.en:
Rizaldy M. is from the village of Binahalan, Gingoog City. He is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rizaldy owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rizaldy has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rizaldy joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el anexo Barrio Muro del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope, distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente en la crianza de animales, ella cría ganado vacuno y caprino para comercializarlos, cuando estos llegan a un buen punto de desarrollo, con los pobladores de zonas aledañas y con los negociantes que visitan el lugar. Adicionalmente en el caso de las vacas aprovecha también la leche que estas producen para comercializarla con sus vecinos. Estas actividades le permiten apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia, su esposo se gana la vida como agricultor.

Gladys desdea mejorar la calidad de los animales que cría y también mejorar la calidad de la leche que producen sus vacas, por ello desea brindarles una alimentación balanceada. Siguiendo su objetivo ha creído necesario solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y hogareña, ella no sólo se dedica a trabajar en su vivienda, sino que también apoya a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 45, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Tranca Sasape’s Barrio Muro annex, a rural area of Mórrope district noted for having most of its population spread out in rural zones; it belongs to Lambayeque province and is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years she has farmed, especially raising animals like cattle and goats. When they reach an ideal weight she sells them to residents in adjacent areas and to merchants who visit the area. In addition, in the case of the cows, she also sells the milk they produce to her neighbors. These activities allow her to help her husband support the family; he earns his living as a farmer. Gladys wants to improve the quality of her animals as well as the quality of the milk her cows produce. For this reason, she wants to provide them with balanced nutrition. To reach this goal, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan. Gladys is a hard-working and home-loving woman. She not only works on her home she also helps her husband with his farming chores. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with respect to her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

location.town: Anexo Barrio Muro - Tranca Sasape - Mórrope - Lamb

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra conformada por varias vecinas quienes tienen muchos deseos de progresar y brindar lo mejor posible en cuanto alimentación y vivienda a sus familias y agradecen mucho a las instituciones que de alguna manera ayudan para que ella puedan concretar sus proyectos.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, ella ofrece a muchos cliente y posteriormente de acuerdo a los pedidos compra los productos de una empresa que le ofrece a un costo bajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de maquillajes, cremas para la limpieza de cutis, para la piel, manos, cabellos, aceites, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of several neighbors who have a strong desire to improve and bring the best possible in nutrition and housing to their families. They are very grateful to the institutions that, in their own ways, help make their projects possible. Mrs. Norma sells cosmetics via catalogues. She shows her catalogues to many customers and then, after receiving the orders, she buys the products from a business that offers her a low price. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy make-up, cuticle cleaning creams, skin and hand lotions, hair oils, perfumes etc.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy body lotion, oils, make-up, hair creams, perfumes etc.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter M. is from Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Dexter owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dexter joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture.

Dexter is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase machinery to expand his business. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to expand his business

loans.name: Mrs. Salorn Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve villagers in Svay Ta Ok village in Kandal province make up this loan group. Mrs. Salorn P. is its president, selected by the others members who will use portions of their loan for different purposes. She is 40 years old and sells corn to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand so she is applying for a loan to buy more corn to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sophea Yen, is a construction worker. The couple has two children both of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more corn to resell

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis Alberto F. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado cuenta con tres hijos, es propietario de una pequeña fábrica de pelotas, una actividad que es muy tradicional en dicha ciudad y su familia.

El Sr. accedió a su primer crédito con nuestra entidad, destinando el dinero para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pelotas como cueros, hilos, agujas, y cuerinas, ya que contaba con un pedido importante, que le permitiría la captación de nueva clientela y de esta forma aumentar su nivel de producción.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto F. is from the city of Carapeguá. He is married and has three children. He owns a small factory that makes balls, an activity that is very traditional in his city and within his family. Luis has qualified for his first loan from our organization, and he is using the funds to purchase raw materials for the production of balls, such as leather, vinyl, needles and thread. This will allow him to fill a large recent order and also to attract new customers, thus increasing his level of production.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying leather, vinyl, needles and thread to make balls

loans.name: Mahira

texts.en: Mahira H., 50, is a widow with three sons. She engages in several activities: she breeds cattle and poultry, and raises corn, sunflowers, and other seasonal fruits and vegetables.  Her monthly profit is 200-250 Azerbaijani manat (AZN). She would like to expand her cattle business as it is very profitable and in high demand. She applied for a loan of 900 AZN to purchase sheep. As she is the only financial source in her family, Mahira works very hard to cover the needs of her dearest sons, who actively help her.

loans.use: purchase eight sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her fish tanks and build a cement wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Elvis Gunnar

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por presentar una geografía accidentada, dada su cercanía con la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a brindar servicio de reparación de todo tipo de calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene como nombre “La Favorita”. Este taller goza de bastante acogida debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando y a la calidad con la que suele realizar su trabajo. Este negocio le ha brindado los ingresos que necesitaba para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre ha tratado de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Elvis desea adquirir algunos repuestos y herramientas para contar son un stock permanente que le permita realizar su trabajo con mayor facilidad. Usualmente, cuando necesita adquirir algun repuesto o herramienta, suele viajar hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlo, esto hace que tenga que gastar en pasajes y hasta perder un dia de trabajo, es por ello que considera bastante importante la inversion que piensa realizar. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elvis es una persona trabajadora, responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando adelante a su taller para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos de consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Elvis is the 51 year old father of four children. He and his family live in the Oyotún district, an agricultural district known for its haphazard geography, given its proximity to the country’s northern mountain range. It’s located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Elvis has been doing shoe repair for more than 20 years from his small shop, called “La Favorita” (The Favorite). This shop brings in plenty of business because of its good service and quality workmanship and provides the income he needs to move his family ahead and give them the best life possible. Elvis wants to buy some supplies and tools so that he can have them in stock, allowing him to improve the quality of his work. Usually, whenever her needs to buy tools or supplies, he travels to Chiclayo to buy them, so he has to pay for travel and lose work days. This is the reason that he considers this

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in a small city in Pakistan called Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She lives in the area of Kullay-wala with her husband and 4 children. Her first two children are enrolled in a local school; the other two are too young to attend school. 

Her husband, M. T., has a dairy business. Currently, he has two buffalos at his home and he gets milk from them to sell. His buffalos give him almost 16-20 kg of milk, which he sells to different milk shops to earn income for the family.   

Nasreen also works. She weaves carpets at her home. The carpets are in high demand in larger cities; people love to buy the handmade carpets to decorate their homes. She is also a very caring mother and a wife. She manages her household well and takes care of her children.  

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production of his business.  

Nasreen is very confident of her family’s bright future. She has trust in her husband that he will bring positive changes to his business by utilizing the loan in a proper way. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved herself a responsible client who always paid installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR DE HUANCA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Libia;   ella tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia es natural de Calca y se dedica a la atención permanente de su pequeña tienda abarrotes; La socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella compra mercadería para abastecer su negocio y continuar con la venta de los diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina,  leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Libia belongs to the “Señor de Huanca” (Lord of Huanca) communal bank, located in the Calca district, Calca province, department of Cusco.

Libia is married, 56 years old, and is a widow with 3 daughters. She is a native of Calca and  is permanently dedicated to her little grocery store. She has to buy merchandise to resupply her business and continue selling different products, such as, for example, rice, sugar, beans, wheat flour, and milk. Libia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and expand her grocery store.

Libia appreciates and values the loan made available by this means and, at the same time, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE AND EXPAND HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Gladys Rosario

texts.es: Gladys tiene 35 años, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad ella es soltera vive en casa de sus padres, inició sus negocio hace ya 6 años, vendiendo comida a los obreros de una construcción y poco a poco fue ganando más clientes, formando así su puesto de venta de comida en su domicilio, tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por lo que necesita una cocina mas grande para que pueda avanzar mas rápido con la preparación de sus platos, el sueño de Gladys es poder incrementar su negocio y atender a todos sus clientes, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Gladys is 35 years old, a single mother with two children, and lives at home with her parents. She started a business six years ago selling food to construction workers. Over time she was able to attract more customers, enabling her to establish a food stall in her home. Gladys needs a larger stove so that she can prepare her dishes more quickly.

She dreams of expanding her business and serving all of her customers. This loan is being granted to Gladys because she has excellent personal references.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
Emelia A., from the village of Calaocan Santiago, is the 47-year-old group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Emelia, who is married and has three grown children, has been raising pigs for fattening and sale for over six years and earns approximately 4000 PHP each time she sells a raised animal.

In 2010, Emelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. Emelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Zulma Arely

texts.es:
Zulma, se dedica a la ganadería, vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos de 13, 9 y 5 años de edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, ella junto a su esposo trabajan con ganado desde hace algún tiempo, se apoyan mutuamente para desarrollar las actividades diarias que demanda la ganadería.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado, su propósito es aumentar el número de animales para atender, con esto dará mayor estabilidad al negocio y tendrá la posibilidad de recibir mejores ingresos para solventar sus necesidades ya que sus hijos aun son  pequeños y necesitan mucho apoyo.
Ella sueña convertirse en una gran comerciante de ganado junto a su esposo, tener ganancias abundantes para dar a sus hijos lo mejor.
texts.en:
Zulma raises cattle. She lives with her husband and her three children, who are 13, 9, and 5 years old. She lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. She and her husband have been working with cattle for a long time. They work together to perform all of the daily activities required by the cattle. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cattle. Her goal is increase her number of animals; this will provide more stability to the business and she will have the opportunity to earn more income to provide for the necessities. Her children are still small and they require a lot of support.

She dreams of becoming a big cattle supplier, along with her husband, and of having abundant profits so she can give her children the best.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo H. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 51 years old. Teofilo is married and has 10 children. To make a living, Teofilo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) services. Teofilo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

Teofilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teofilo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Orna

texts.en:
Orna is a single mother of two who is working hard to ensure a better future for herself and her children. She has important emotional support from her parents, enabling her to open her business while studying for her Masters in Education. Orna is a private tutor and instructor from the prestigious Israeli Bar Ilan mathematics program for elementary through high school students. Orna is opening a math tutoring business for groups. She has a strong base of potential clientele from her existing tutoring and education connections. There is a strong need in Tel Aviv for math tutors, especially at Orna's level. The draw of group tutoring as opposed to individual is large since it holds down the individual costs for students, while creating a supportive small group atmosphere as well. For Orna, it means a larger amount of per hour income as opposed to one-on-one tutoring. 

The loan is needed to pay for renovations to create a classroom setting, supplies and advertising.

Orna will use her current connections with different schools in the area. With this loan, she is moving her business to a location with increased diversity and higher socio-economic possibilities. In the future, Orna wants to expand her business and hire additional tutors to work with the ever-growing number of student groups.

loans.use: To pay for renovations to create a classroom setting, supplies and advertising.

loans.name: Tanya Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Tanya es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo del Banco. Tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y12 años, todos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es profesor de escuela.

Tiene un local donde es papelería y además es un centro de servicios informáticos. Allí también vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta 19h00, lleva dos años en este negocio y que lo ido implementando poco a poco con los créditos del Banco.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, hojas, y otros artículos de papelería. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que el que tiene es arrendado y este se le lleva parte de su ganancia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 11 of September Communal Bank meets every 15 days.  The locality is known for its traditional culture and, also, for ts location, just a few minutes from 2 of the province's main beaches, namely San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Tanya is the founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes everything about the bank. She is 39 year of age, married, and she has 3 children from this union, aged 16, 14  and 12.  They all study in school. Her husband is a school teacher.

Tanya has a shop that sells paper and, in addition, is a center of computer science services.  Here, also, she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). Tanya works every day from 8:30 am until 7:00 pm. She has had this business for 2 years, expanding it little by little with loans from the Bank.

The present loan is to buy creams, perfumes, paper, and other articles for a stationers. Her dream is to own her shop, since she rents the one she has and this costs her part of her earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY CREAMS, PERFUMES, PACKETS OF PAPER, AND MORE ARTICLES FOR HER STATIONERS SHOP

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and 2 siblings. He has worked as a plumber for more than 15 years and in 2002 he decided to work on his own, depending on customers' demands. At the same time, he also works in a construction company. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses to handle the family’s expenses. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client. 
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional products that will help him to expand his business and stick with several construction projects.

loans.use: buy additional products and stick with construction projects

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 33 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años de edad, Carmen se dedica a la venta de Meriendas, tiene este negocio hace 8 años, lo atiende sola todos los días ya que de acá dependen los recursos con los que cuenta para ella y sus hijos. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería y productos de cocina como: maíz, leña, aceite, carnes y condimentos, dichos productos los necesita a diario para preparar los alimentos que exhibe a la venta para los clientes.
Su aspiración es ser una persona sobresaliente  en la vida, que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para poder desarrollarse como profesionales y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 33-year-old single mother who lives with her 3 children, ages 13, 8, and 2 in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután. Carmen sells lunches for a living, and she has been in business for 8 years. She runs this business on her own every day as she depends on it for the funds she needs for herself and her children.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise and kitchen products like corn, firewood, cooking oil, meats, and condiments, products she needs daily to prepare the meals she sells to her patrons.

Her aspiration is to be an outstanding person in life. She also hopes that her children will have what is necessary for them to become professionals, and she wants to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, cooking oil, meats, and condiments

loans.name: Auxilladora

texts.en:
Auxilladora lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is widowed. She works hard to provide for her children. She grows rice and owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She earns money by selling her harvest to rice traders. She says that the store also helps in providing their daily needs. Auxilladora is planning to start a backyard piggery.

Auxilladora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Auxilladora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Auxilladora is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and invest in backyard piggery.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and invest in backyard piggery

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 40 años “es una mujer trabajadora”, que junto a su esposo Esequiel y sus 2 hijos, viven en armonía familiar en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de cítricos como: naranja y tangelo. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad y según afirma lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es “recalzar” (proceso de podar las plantas que no dieron frutos para poder realizar viveros). Además de cuidar sus cultivos, también trabaja en una hacienda donde le pagan cada fin de semana una suma considerable de dinero por podar, machetear y quitar la maleza de los cultivos de cítricos. Ahora ella está juntando dinero para poder comprar una moto taxi y así incursionar en el trasporte público. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera obtener el apoyo necesario para poder hacer realidad sus objetivos. Luisa, constantemente realiza la limpieza de sus cultivos, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también podrá contratar personal para poder realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
40 year-old Luisa "is a hard-working woman" who, together with her husband Esequiel and their two children, lives in familial harmony in her own home which is located in Guacamayo community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This hard-working woman is a farmer.  Her main crops are citrus fruits such as oranges and tangelos.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she tells us that what she likes most about her work is pruning the plants that haven't borne fruit so that she can make nurseries.  As well as looking after her own crops, Luisa also works on an estate where they pay her a considerable sum of money each weekend to prune, cut and weed their citrus fruit crops.

Right now, Luisa is putting together some money so that she can buy a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers and / or goods) so that she can start providing public transport services.  She belongs to the "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo'" (New Dawn of Guacamayo) community bank and this is her first loan cycle with MFP.  She hopes to obtain the support she needs to reach her goals.

Luisa is constantly weeding her crops and, for this reason, she is planning to use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure and to hire workers to weed her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire workers to help her weed her fields

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa O. M., 35, is married to Paulina M. and they have three children. He lives in Narok, Kenya and he has been in cash crop farming for the last eight years.

Musa is a humble client who knew KADET through other clients in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to spend the loan proceeds to prepare land for farming. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits back into the farm. He dreams of becoming a big farmer.

Musa can do more if provided with the resources.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming.

loans.name: Kindet Ole Kipiriro

texts.en:
Kindet Ole is 28, single, and supports five people. He lives in Narok, Kenya. He has been farming for the last four years. 

He is a humble client. He knew KADET through other clients registered with KADET in his area. This will be his first loan from KADET. He intends to use the entire loan amount to prepare the land for farming.

The anticipated profit he generates will be put back into the farm. He hopes to practice large scale farming in the future. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming

loans.name: Iyali Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Iyali". Está ubicado en Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Guadalupe S. G. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapato, inició hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para más pares de zapatos para su negocio. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir.  También espera con este préstamo obtener mejores ganancias y así obtener más clientes e invertirlo hasta que su negocio crezca y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Reyna M. es otra integrante de este grupo, tiene 42 años, estudió hasta la secundaria. Es casada y sus hijos ya se casaron. Ella tiene una tienda, su negocio lo inicio hace 10 años ya que en ese tiempo tuvo problemas económicos ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo por lo que ella en busca de oportunidades pudo emprender su tienda que hoy en dia es muy conocida en su comunidad. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancia. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que con este crédito comprará más productos y siempre tener lo que buscan sus clientes como azucar, aceites y refrescos. También espera con este préstamo tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Iyali". It is located in Puebla, Mexico. There are 10 members of the group. Guadalupe is the president of the group. She is 38 years old and she studied until the 6th grade of primary school. She works selling shoes, and she began doing this 15 years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more pairs of shoes. When applying for this loan, she is excited and eager to excel. She also hopes to increase her income with this loan and to get more clients so that she can grow her business and gain a better quality of life. Reyna is another member of the group. She is 42 years old and studied up to secondary school. She is married and her children are already married. She has a store and she started her business 10 years ago because, at this time, she had economic problems as her husband was out of work so she went looking for opportunities and started her store. Today the store is very well known in the community. She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise. When applying for this loan she feels excited as she will be able to buy more goods with the loan and will always have the things her clients are looking for, like sugar, oil, and sodas. She also hopes that, with the help of this loan, she will have a better quality of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for their business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He takes care of the family with the help of his wife who is also a businesswoman. Their dream is to educate their children up to university, since they did not get the chance to go to school. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years and this has facilitated him in educating his children and building a semi-permanent house, although he still has the challenges of limited finances, making it difficult to meet the demands of his customers. His dream is to become a wholesaler. Justus needs the loan to buy soap and millet flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is one year old; his wife looks after the baby at the moment. 

Recently they moved to a one-bedroom apartment which they bought last March. Altansukh runs a taxi business using his family car and it is the only source of the family’s income. 

Altansukh is planning to do some interior decoration in the old apartment which he bought. The loan he is taking will be used to buy wallpaper, plaster, glue, paint and to do interior decoration in the old apartment which he bought recently.

loans.use: To buy wallpaper, plaster, glue, paint and to do interior decoration on the old apartment.

loans.name: Kajik

texts.en: Kajik is engaged in agriculture.  He needs to supply forage for his livestock. He plans to do haying which requires a grass cutting machine. He also would like to hire workers to help him with haying. With the loan’s help, Kajik will earn income and also provide forage for his cattle. The income generation is absolutely vital for Kajik and his family, a wife and two children.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutting machine and hire workers.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 35-year-old, married woman with three children.  To earn a living, she operates a beauty salon.  She started the business two years ago.  She runs the salon in a very competitive environment but she is able to retain her customers because of her good services.
Phanice dreams of opening other salons in the future for more income generation.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Qambokwethu Group

texts.en:
Bizani is 54 years old and married with 6 children, between ages of 12 and 34 years old.  She also takes care of 2 relatives.  Three months ago, she opened a small store from her home where she sells cold drinks, cell phone minutes, and meat.  She receives additional income by working on a road maintenance crew for the South African government.

Bizani requested a loan from WDB and Kiva so that she can purchase chickens to raise for her store.  She faces difficulties right now because her store is new and has no customers, but she hopes that this loan will allow her to expand her stock and increase her customers.  With the income she generates from her store, she will send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es: Paulita es una mujer muy emprendedora que a pesar de la situación económica que esta en el país, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada de buena calidad que ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos aun bajo precio. Paulita es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida por tal motivo  opto por dedicarse al negocio que instala solo los fines de semana con el fin de no descuidar a su familia y quehaceres del hogar. El negocio ha permanecido 8 años por la atención que ofrece y amabilidad al atender a sus clientes, esta es parte de su fuente de ingresos a parte la que su esposo gana por trabajar en maquiladora. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar mercancía de temporada.
texts.en: Paulita is a very enterprising woman who, despite the economic situation in the country, has a business selling good quality used clothing that she offers to her friends and neighbors at an even lower price. Paulita is the mother of two little ones who wants to provide them a better quality of life.  For that reason, she chooses to have a business that operates only on weekends in order not to neglect her family and household chores. The business has been operating for 8 years because of the care and kindness she offers to serve her customers.  This business is part of their source of income apart from what her ​​husband earns working in a factory. In order for the business to continue generating income, she needs to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Julio desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  También cuenta con sus tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa a un buen precio en los diferentes mercados.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Julio es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Julio, 39, lives with his wife and children in his own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in a rural area in Tambogrande in the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture and livestock activities and it handicrafts.

For a number of years Julio has been raising and selling sheep.  His corral is located in the back of his house, and is well equipped and expansive.  He feeds his animals with nutritionally balanced animal feed and pasture grass.  Once his animals reach an optimal size, he offers them for sale in the different markets in the area, and in this way obtains good earnings to pay his daily household expenses.  In addition, he has some land where he cultivates lemons, and when he harvests the lemons he sells them for a good price in the different markets.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,800 Peruvian soles to buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers to improve the land that he cultivates.  With the income that he will earn he will pay off the loan and improve the quality of life of his family.  Julio is a hardworking and responsible man who only wants his children to do well in life; he wants to improve his finances so that he can provide them with a college education.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers to improve his farmlands

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.es: Beatriz es madre soltera de 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, artículos para el hogar y calzado nuevo por catalogo, al verse ella con la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos con las necesidades básicas, alimentación, calzado,  vestido, educación emprendió un negocio que le permitiera atender a sus 3 hijos y al mismo tiempo proveerlos de  lo necesario para que pudieran vivir bien y así fue como desde 4 años este negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos; ella quiere comprar mas artículos de segunda mano para invertirle a su negocio y con las ganancias que ella saque incrementar los productos para su venta y al mismo tiempo mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Beatriz is a single mother with 3 children who sells used clothing and new home furnishings and footwear by catalogue. Faced with the responsibility of supporting her children and providing them with basic necessities such as food, shoes, clothing and an education, she started a business that would allow her to take care of her 3 children and at the same time provide them with what they needed to get ahead. For the past 4 years this business has been her only source of income. She wants to buy more second hand clothing in order to invest in her business. With her profits she will increase the quantity of goods for sale and at the same time improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man with three children. One of his children attends school while two are still young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa vive por la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas, son personas muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado y no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace algún tiempo y vende en los días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de  camisetas, pantalones, blusas y ropa de niños para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Quinta Chica Parish in the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  Many work in the city in various jobs.  They are kind and charming people.

Rosa, 30, is married and has a four-year-old son.  Her husband is a private employee and they do not own a house; they rent.  

She sells all sorts of clothes.  She’s been in this line of work for some time now selling on market days.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children’s clothes to stock her business more.  Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children; 2 are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her small boutique, which sells clothes and beauty supplies. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes, and will help Jessica to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her business. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jessica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a roll of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 39 años, es una mujer valiente y muy trabajadora, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de once y seis años, vive en un casa alquilada junto a su hermano con quien comparten los gastos del hogar. Su trabajo  consiste en le venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, por tanto posee una tienda donde expende estos productos, asimismo vende helados, gaseosas, raspadillas, bebidas alcohólicas, hasta realiza recarga de línea para celulares. Su negocio es muy variado y es la más grade de la cuadra, y por tal es la más concurrida ya que los clientes encuentran de todo ahí. Este trabajo lo realiza sola, mientras sus hijos están en el colegio, pero cuando no tienen nada que hacer, la mayor la apoyan en la atención de la clientela. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder realizar muchas actividades más, ya que vende algunos productos por catálogos en su tiempo libre. Le esta yendo bien y sus ganancias son buenas, espera poder ampliar mas adelante su negocio. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Esta muy agradecida con la institución ya que le dan la oportunidad de poder crecer con su inversión. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para abastecer su tienda, pues le esta faltando arroz, azúcar, verduras y algunos otros productos que si compra en cantidad gasta menos en pasaje y le dan a un menor costo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is a brave and hard working woman. Elizabeth is a single mother of two children, aged 11 and 6. She lives in a rented house with her brother who splits the expenses with her. Her works consists of the retail sale of essentials, therefore she has a store where she sells these products, as well as ice cream, soft drinks, snow cones, and alcoholic beverages; she even sells minutes for prepaid cellphones. Her business is very varied and is the largest on the block; for this reason, it’s the most popular store because customers find everything there.

She works alone, while her children are in school, but when they don’t have anything to do, her oldest daughter helps her wait on customers. What she likes most about her work is that she has time to do many other things, as she also sells some products via catalog in her free time. Things are going well and her income is good. She hopes to expand her business farther. This will be her second loan with MFP, therefore, she hopes for the support of each one of you. She is very pleased with MFP since with their investment, they give her the opportunity to be able to grow. With the amount requested, she will buy merchandise to stock her store, because she needs rice, sugar, vegetables and some other items. If she buys these in bulk, she will spend less on transportation and will be given a better price.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, vegetables and other canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, married and mother of eight children.

Sanaa has been an owner of a weaving workshop since 2003. She learned this trade from her mother. She has a good reputation and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. She is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1200 in order to purchase a split air conditioner and a generator for her workshop. She is aiming to get more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner and generator for her workshop.

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en:
Yarn, 29, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Yarn is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Yarn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, she will save on transportation costs. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Mangule

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2  filhos dos quais um ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É cabelereira ha mais de 15 anos e dona do salão e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(chapas, areia, cimento, pedra,  e outros).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 13.000.00mt,todos para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e construir uma Pastelaria para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mangule was born in the District of Boane, in the Province of Maputo in the South of Mozambique. She’s single and the mother of 2 children, one of whom still attends School. She completed 4th grade and didn’t continue her education due to her parents’ lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn’t support anyone else.

Mangule has been a hairdresser for more than 15 years, as well as the owner of a salon and has a monthly income of around 5,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she spends on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and she came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fifth loan from Hluvuku, for 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase construction materials to continue the build of her home (plates, sand, cement, stone and others). Her first loans were for: 7,000.00 MZN, 8,000.00 MZN, 13,000.00 MZN and 13,000.00 MZN, all of which she used for her house.

Mangule commits to paying off her loan and in the future intends to complete the construction of her home and build a cake & pastry shop in order to increase her income. To this end, she expects to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials to continue the build of her home (plates, sand, cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Lutacho No.7 A Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the facilitator of the Lutacho No.7 A group. Agnes and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a very good maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Agnes will invest in livestock rearing and send her children to school.

In 2012, the members of Lutacho No.7 A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Agnes with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Las Perseverantes es un grupo que esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica para sacar a delante a sus familias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.Este grupo esta ubicado en una región donde hay muchas huleras (muchos arboles de hule) y como el clima es fresco se cosecha el café y la naranja.

Reyna es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio una carrera en sistemas computacionales y es soltera, Reyna nos platica que hace unos meses con el apoyo de su familia abrió un CiberCafe en un local que tiene en su hogar en el cual todos los días de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche brinda el servicio a sus clientes de renta de computadoras, impresiones y la elaboración de trabajos, También nos platica que los fines de semana imparte cursos a los niños y jóvenes de su comunidad.

Ella dice que Trabaja muy a gusto en su negocio y que le deja buenas ganancias ya que es el unico cibercafe de la comunidad.

Reyna necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de una computadora, tinta y hojas blancas para continuar trabajando en su negocio.

Ella platica que todos los días pone muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que desea que siga creciendo poco a poco.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Adilene venta de zapatos 
Agueda venta de plasticos
Maria Concepcion venta de dulces
Carmela venta de trastes de platico 
rosa Angela venta de antojitos
Loyda club nutricional
Maria Cohinta venta de papeleria
Victoria venta de reposteria 
Agueda venta de calzado 
MAtilde tienda de ropa
texts.en:
Las Perseverantes has 11 members, all hard-working women, who operate various businesses that help support their families and improve their quality of life.  The members live in a rubber-producing area (surrounded by rubber trees).  The climate is mild and suitable for growing coffee and oranges.

Reyna, 25, is a member of the group.  She is single and has a computer systems background.  She tells us that, with help from her family, she started an Internet cafe several months ago.  She operates the business from a space in her house and works every day from 8:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night.  She sells computer and copier services.  She adds that she provides tutorials for teens and children at weekends.

Reyna says that her Internet cafe is the only one in town and that the business is doing very well.

Reyna will use this loan to buy a computer, ink and paper for the business.

She adds that she enjoys the work because she wants to continue growing her business.

The other members of the group are:

Adilene: shoe sales.
Agueda: plastic sales.
Maria Concepcion: snack sales.
Carmela: plastic flower sales.
Angela: snack sales.
Loyda: vitamin sales.
Maria Cohinta: school-supply sales.
Victoria: pastry sales.
Agueda: footwear sales.
Matilde: clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy a computer and other supplies for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by providing computer maintenance services. His business has grown because he provides excellent service. He hopes to continue expanding his small company, and is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon
