Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio y termina de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mónica is 39 years old and runs a stationery shop (in Ecuador it is caled a "bazar"). She lives in a peri-urban area of Guayaquil called "Paraíso" ("Paradise"), which is characterized by its dirt roads. She started her stationery shop in order to support her family by selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she got together enough money to set up her small stationery shop, she readjusted her house and set the shop up in the front part. She works every day from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She wants to buy notebooks, pens, and showcases for her business with this loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stationery and notebooks

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
Emmanuel, que significa Dios con Nosotros, está conformado por once integrantes, ellos viven en la Comunidad Cerro del Márquez a las orillas de Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Sus deseos de superarse son inmensos y es por eso que están dispuestos a esforzarse día a día y agradecen el apoyo brindado por parte de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad.

Oliva O. G. tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria del estado de Oaxaca, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios así que se vino a trabajar a la ciudad de México. Hace diecinueve años comenzó con la venta de ajos, chiles secos, canela, semillas, etc. Durante la noche se dedica a envolver su canela y embolsar sus ajos para que al otro día muy temprano pueda comenzar con sus ventas en los tianguis que se hacen por su comunidad, desde las ocho de la mañana comienza a caminar en el tianguis para vender ya que no tiene un lugar fijo para establecerse, ella trata de surtir cada ocho días para así tener siempre mercancía y para entregar los pedidos que le hacen durante la semana. Oliva planea iniciar con una nueva actividad que le dé un ingreso más y no tener que pasar necesidades. Con el crédito solicitado comprara mercancía como: canelas, papel de estraza, bolsas, ligas, chiles secos, etc. Y podrá vender un poco más.

Los demás integrantes son: 
Ana María Clara F. M. (Venta de manualidades de foamy)
María Olivia H. H. (Venta de manteles y carpetas)
Angélica O. G. (Venta de pan)
América Amanda R. (Venta de colchas y edredones por catalogo)
Adelina M. O. (Venta de joyería de plata)
Ascensión R. A. (Venta de ganado y leche)
Gabriela M. (Venta de joyería de pedrería)
Araceli E. V. (Venta de Cosméticos por catalogo)
Abe linda P. C. (Jarcie ría)
Norma M. G. (Venta de Perfumes por Catalogo).
texts.en:
Emmanuel, which means "God with us," is made up of eleven members. They live in the Cerro del Márquez community on the edges of the Chalco Valley, in the State of México. They have an immense desire to get ahead, and for this reason they are ready to work hard every day, and they are grateful for the support provided to them on Kiva's part and through the Realidad Foundation. Oliva O. G. is 57 years old and comes from the state of Oaxaca. Unfortunately, she did not have the opportunity to finish her studies; instead, she went to Mexico City to work. Nineteen years ago, she began selling garlic, dried chilies, cinnamon, seeds, etc. During the night, she works wrapping her cinnamon and bagging her garlic so that she can begin very early the next day with her sales at the markets set up for her community. Starting at eight in the morning, she walks through the markets to sell her products, since she does not have a fixed place for her business. She tries to restock her products every eight days, so that she will always have merchandise and so that she can fill the orders placed with her during the week. Oliva plans to begin a new activity which will give her another source of income, so that she does not have to do without the necessities. With the requested loan, she will buy merchandise such as cinnamon, brown paper, bags, string, rubber bands, etc. With this, she will be able to sell a bit more. The other members are: Ana María Clara F. M. (Sale of handicrafts made from colored foam sheets) María Olivia H. H. (Sale of tablecloths and portfolios) Angélica O. G. (Bread sales) América Amanda R. (Sale of quilts and bedding by catalog) Adelina M. O. (Silver jewelry sales) Ascensión R. A. (Livestock and milk sales) Gabriela M. (Costume jewelry sales) Araceli E. V. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Abe linda P. C. (Cleaning products) Norma M. G. (Perfume sales by catalog).

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cinnamon, chilies, seeds, bags, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand her business by purchasing a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano S. era investigador de la policia y debido a un accidente que le fractura la espalda en cumplimiento de su deber ya no pudo laborar ahí, recibe pension, en este momento a el le dieron la oportunidad de ser guardia de seguridad o vigilante en una escuela en la que frecuentemente era visistada por los ladrones, el ahora vive dentro de la escuela le acondicionaron unos salones, a base de sacrificios y tocando puertas le ha estado dando estudio a su hija, para eso solicito el credito. ya que el y su esposa la señora Maria, quieren lo mejor para su hija que esta estudiando la universisas.necesitan pagar la colegiatura para el mejor futuro de ella.
texts.en: Mariano was a police inspector but, due to an accident in the line of duty that broke his back, he can no longer do that job. He was recently given the opportunity to work as a security guard or watchman in a school that was often visited by thieves. He now lives in some rooms at the school. Thanks to sacrifices that he made and lots of knocking on doors, he has been able to send his daughter to school, and this is what he wants a loan for. He and his wife, María, want the best for their daughter who is studying at the university. They need to pay tuition so that she will have a better future.

loans.use: To pay for university for his daughter

loans.name: 020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Man N. T. (27) is a 58 year old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Man is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu (020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu).

Man is married and has 5 adult children. To making a living, Man operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Man has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Man joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Man has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Man plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Uyen P. T. (20) is a 55 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
2.  Thanh T. H. (62) is a 30 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
3.  Hoa P. T. (25) is a 55 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  Khanh P. T. (112) is a 31 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store business.
5.  Hau N. T. (28) is a 32 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
6.  T. N. T. (22) is a 51 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
7.  Tan N. T. (21) is a 61 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
8.  Khanh N. T. (3) is a 47 year old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Man N. T. (27) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Man là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu (020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Man thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Man kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Man đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Man đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:
1.  Uyen P. T. (20) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
2.  Thanh T. H. (62) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
3.  Hoa P. T. (25) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
4.  Khanh P. T. (112) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.
5.  Hau N. T. (28) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
6.  T. N. T. (22) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
7.  Tan N. T. (21) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
8.  Khanh N. T. (3) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Julius Kimaiyo

texts.en:
Julius A. is 63 years old from Kapkures in Vihiga. He is married to Sally, a poultry farmer, and together they have one daughter.

Julius has run a business of rearing livestock for the past 5 years and earns around Kshs 19,900 per month.. He is applying for his sixth loan from Kadet Ltd and has a good credit history. Julius intends to use the money to expand his cattle stock by buying three dairy cows and renewing his trade license as well.

His hope and desire is to establish a cattle ranch and to be able to supply the Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.use: To buy three dairy cows.

loans.name: Yusseff

texts.es: Yuseff, de 31 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Desde hace algún tiempo se independizó y ahora vive en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa Yapaz (selva central peruana). Hace 6 años, que se dedica a la siembra de café, plátano, fréjoles y maíz. Después de cada cosecha vende su producción a los intermediarios en la ciudad de Santa Ana. Lo que más le desagrada a Yuseff, son los problemas de bajo costo de su producción, pero él es más astuto y constantemente busca nuevos mercados para poder comercializar sus productos. Pero no desea conformarse, es así que espera tener otro ingreso con la venta de madera, negocio que desea incursionar, pues sabe que de las ganancias que reciba podrá invertir en la siembra de 6 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas aproximadamente. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y cuenta que en este corto tiempo, ganó la confianza de mucho de los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes están agradecidos por el apoyo que en todo este tiempo obtuvieron. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 20 sacos de abono y, si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la compra de una motosierra (máquina que le sirve para poder cortar árboles).
texts.en:
Yuseff, 31 years old, is a single and hard-working man. Some time ago he became independent and now he lives in his own home located in the town of Santa Rosa Yapaz (central Peruvian jungle). For six years, he has been sowing coffee, bananas, beans and corn. After each harvest, he sells his production to intermediaries in the city of Santa Ana. What Yuseff dislikes most are the problems of low costs of his production, but he is more astute and is constantly searching new markets to market his products. But he doesn't want to conform, and therefore he hopes to have other income with the sale of wood, a business that he hopes to carry out.

He knows that with the profits that he receives, he could invest it in the sowing of approximately six hectares of agricultural farmland. This is his third loan with MFP, and in this short time, he earned the confidence of many of the members of his community bank, who are grateful for the support that they obtained during this time. For this reason he thought to invest the loan in the purchase of 20 sacks of fertilizer, and if the money is still available, he will invest it in the purchase of a chain saw (a machine that will allow him to be able to cut trees).

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and a chain saw

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B., from the town of Trinidad, is the 36-year-old married mother of four children aged 15, 13, 9 and 7. For over three years Jocelyn has operated a hog business, raising them for fattening and sale. She earns approximately 2000 PHP a month, working hard to sustain her children's education and dreaming that they finish college and have bright futures.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feeds. Jocelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
Guljan B. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46 years old and is married to a truck driver. Together they are raising two daughters and a son. Nine years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, Guljan opened a cafeteria. She earns 20000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her family to start building a new house in Bishkek. With money received from the loanm Guljan wants to improve their living conditions and purchase a TV. In the future, she plans to finish the house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a television for her home

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada, tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en la provincia D. Anta distrito D. Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Francisca se dedica a la ganadería, él venD. sus animales en la feria D. la comunidad D. Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad D. Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos D. ciudad principal D. Anta.  Francisca que espera recibir D. S/. 800 nuevos soles D. crédito y va comprar ganado como por ejemplo vacas, ovejas, chanchos y muchas animales más. 

Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” D. la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Francisca, 54, is married and has five children.  They all live in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Francisca raises cattle.  She sells her animals in Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city in Anta. Francisca expects to get an 800 new sol loan to buy livestock like cows, sheep, pigs and many other animals.

Francisca is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been operating for a year and is well administered by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy livestock like: cattle, sheep, pigs and many other animals.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with eight children, six of whom attend school while two have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over twenty years, she has operated a food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business, the price of foodstuffs being so high. She hopes to renovate her workplace and sell a variety of foods in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y su hijo, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva, este negocio nació hace 3 años, las ventas las realiza en las calles y en su casa.
Ella necesita invertir en el negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar pendras de vestir, ya que los clientes le demandan estilos nuevos y ella en ocasiones no los tiene, con esta inversión ella espera mejorar su atención y que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio las prendas que necesitan.
Con el préstamo ella tiene como objetivo: realizar una buena inversión, atender de la mejor manera a los clientes, con su familia espera mejorar su condición y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña María is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son.  They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She has been selling new clothing from her house and on the street for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing since her customers want the newest styles and occasionally, she doesn't have them.  She hopes to improve her customer service with this loan so that she can provide her customers with the clothing they need.  With the loan her objectives are to make a good investment and to give her customers the best service.  She also hopes to improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent. 

She has operated a clothes business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also sells vegetables, which contributes to her other source of income. Rose faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a permanent house in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase ten bundles of clothes and sacks of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase ten bundles of clothes and sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 46 years old and has four children between 8 and 21 years old. Ernest‘s wife sells foodstuffs. Ernest mills maize (corn), using a machine which grinds and sifts the corn into flour. Ernest has run this business for eleven years, and the business has enabled him to feed his family and to pay school fees for his children. With the profits, Ernest hopes to save his money until he can afford to buy another machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy another flour mill.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M. M. is a married lady. The husband works with Kenya Railways Corporation and they have four chidren aged 1 - 5 years. Her business is located at Githunguri and she is served by Kitengela branch.

She owns a beauty salon called Wachiru Hair Salon. She cuts and styles ladies hair in the local area. She has been in this business for four years and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is financial constraints. However she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep doing well.

She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy salon equipments, hair additions, relaxers and treatments to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and in future open a hairdressing school. She describes herself as active, loving, hardworking and friendly.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment, relaxers, treatments etc

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 52 and is married with three children aged between 8 and 15 years old.  He owns a small store where he sells various goods such as sugar, rice, bread and lotions.  Jean Marie Vianney has been engaged in this business for five years and he currently employs one person to help him. His business is open from 6am to 7pm every day.  

Alphonse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy additional goods such as: lotions, braids, salt, sugar, soap and beans, etc. to sell to make a good profit. With any extra profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as  lotions, braids, salt, sugar, soap and beans to sell.

loans.name: Trifina

texts.es:
La señora Trifina de 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, su hijo ya es mayor de edad, ella cuenta con un Consultorio Odontológico, es mecánica dental y anexo vende materiales e insumos odontológicos, empezó hace más de 10 años ayudando a personas de escasos recursos, puesto que el costo de su servicio es bastante accesible.
Acudió a Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinaría a la compra de insumos odontológicos como ser: Dientes postizos, frenillos, anestesia y otros. La misma al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva porque gracias a la simple oportunidad de solicitar el crédito tiene la esperanza de que va a poder seguir brindando servicio de buena calidad a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Trifina is 53 years old, and a single mother of a grown son. She works with Consultorio Odontológico as a dentist and in addition she sells materials and dentistry products. She began doing this more than 10 years ago helping people with limited resources since the cost of her service is very accessible. 
She turned to Fundación Paraguaya to obtain a little credit help that will allow her to buy dentistry products such as false teeth, braces, anesthesia and others. As she takes the aid, she thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because thanks to the simple opportunity of requesting a loan she has the hope that she will be able to offer her good quality service to all her clients.

loans.use: to buy dentistry products such as false teeth, braces, anesthesia etc.

loans.name: Ma. Ruth

texts.en:
Ma. Ruth A. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Ruth owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Ma. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,130 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ma. Ruth joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits for sale. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for resale.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zinsou

texts.fr: Né en 1974, Zinsou est marié à Vicencia une couturière. Le couple à quatre enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Zinsou et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Zinsou n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, mais a appris le métier de soudure ; activité qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Avec ce crédit qu'il sollicite, Zinsou désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure (chalumeaux, maneaux, gaz, etc.). Zinsou s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Zinsou demande l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Born in 1974, Zinsou is married to Vincencia, a seamstress. They take care of four children, two of whom are theirs. All of the children go to school. Zinsou and his wife live in the same house, with their children. Together they share the various family-related expenses. Zinsou attended primary school only, but learned the trade of welding, thanks to which he can meet the needs of his customers and financially support his family. With this loan, Zinsou would like to expand his business by purchasing welding supplies (torches, pressure regulators, gas, etc.). Zinsou buys his supplies from Nigeria, a neighboring country of Bénin. This is the second time that Zinsou requests a loan from ALIDé, in order to increase his business and see both his customer base and income grow.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies (torches, gas, pressure regulators)

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 31 and a single mother of two children. She sells second-hand bedding, a business she has been in for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd. and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use the loan funds to buy more bedsheets for resale. 

Magdaline will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy used bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Maushi

texts.en:
Maushi is a married woman with two girls – one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle business. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators. She dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future.

With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to start another business and purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start another business by purchasing bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old business man.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He is married and blessed with two children, hence he works hard in his business to provide for his family.  He has sustained his business for eleven years because of his good services.  He used his previous loan to boost his business.

He hopes to expand his business within five years.  He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 40 years old and married with two children. Her children are 14 and 17 years old and both attend school. Marina's business is selling crafts at various markets around the Cusco region. She makes all of the crafts she sells, such as hats and small bags. With this loan, Marina plans on purchasing more wool and thread to make a greater number of crafts that she can sell. She is very hardworking and works every day of the week making products or selling them at different markets.

loans.use: to buy more wool and thread to make crafts.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson tiene 23 años, convive con Roselda de 21 años y fruto de su amorío tienen 02 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situada en la ciudad de san francisco. Emerson a su corta edad tuvo su primer hijo y desde entonces cuenta con múltiples necesidades, es por ello que se esmera en trabajar arduamente en sus campos de cultivo donde siembra variedad de plantas como: cacao, café y palillo, las cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a los puntos de acopio de distintas empresas, quienes sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos le remuneran muy bien por sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir los insectos que se apoderan de las flores de cada plantación, es por ello que tiene que combatirlos con insecticidas naturales para no dañar el medio ambiente. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas muy fructíferas. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado y por ende se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas programadas. Los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
23-year old Emerson lives with 21-year old Roselda and their two children in their own home located in the town of San Francisco. Emerson had his first son at a young age and since then has had many needs. For that reason he puts a lot of effort into his farm where he grows a variety of crops such as cocoa, coffee, and palillo. After harvesting the products, he takes them to the warehouses of several businesses where he is known for the quality of his crops and where he is paid well. 

The part Emerson most enjoys about his work is planting out his fields and making them fertile and productive. He’s been doing this work for four years. The most difficult part is dealing with the insects that attack the flowers. For this reason he has to destroy them by using natural insecticides so that the environment is not harmed. 

With the loan he is seeking, Emerson will buy bags of manure to fertilize his land and make it more productive. In the future he hopes to continue saving money to buy more land. This is his first loan and he is very happy to know that he has financial support to go ahead with his plans. He promises to repay the money punctually. The 3,000 sole loan will be used to buy organic fertlizer.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Miladys Dayana

texts.es: Miladys  de 21 años de edad es la propietaria del negocio “Creaciones J.M.” en él maneja una confección en la que tien 7 maquinarias planas e industriales, ubicada en una habitación en la vivienda de sus padres. Miladys fabrica todo tipo de ropas, informal e industrial. Este negocio fue iniciado hace 7 años por iniciativa de sus padres y ahora Miladys asumió su administración y muy pronto será una profesional del diseño industrial porque cursa el sexto semestre en la Universidad. Su meta más adelante es estructurar procesos productivos con nuevas y modernas maquinarias, posicionando sus diseños desde la ciudad de Barranquilla para el mundo. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rentabilidad sobre los activos del 6% y sobre las ventas del 55%. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará rollos de telas de jeans para producir 150 unidades sobre un pedido y necesita ser oportuna en su respuesta. Su inversión será exitosa en la medida en que con ello gana un nuevo cliente por volumen y con ello  aumentaría sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miladys is 21 years old and the owner of a business called “Creaciones J.M.” where she manages seven tabletop and industrial sewing machines. Her business is located in her parents’ home. Miladys makes all types of clothes, including casual and industrial. Her parents started this business seven years ago, but now Miladys has taken over the responsibilities of managing it. Very soon she will receive her professional degree in industrial design after she finishes her sixth semester at the university. Her goal in the future is to restructure her production processes with new and modern machines. This will help her designs gain market position in the city of Barranquilla and around the world.

In the meantime, Miladys is able to maintain a return on assets of 6% and a sales rate of 55%. She is applying for her first Kiva loan so that she can buy rolls of denim for producing 150 units for an order that she needs to fulfill. Her investment will be successful in terms of gaining a new client that orders in volume, which will increase her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of denim so that she can complete a large order.

loans.name: Jose  Humberto

texts.es: El Sr Humberto solicita a nuestra institución un crédito para poner una pequeña losa de concreto al frente de su  vivienda y así proteger a su familia de las inclemencias del tiempo, comenta el sr Humberto que sobre todo en épocas de lluvia el agua se mete por la puerta principal ocasionando que la sala de su casa se moje y quede un ambiente de humedad, provocando enfermedades a su familia.
texts.en: Sr. Humberto is requesting a loan from Credituyo so that he can install a small concrete slab at the front of his house that will protect his family from inclement weather.  He says that during the entire rainy season, the main entrance hall of his house gets damp and starts holding moisture, thereby promoting diseases that could make his family ill.

loans.use: to install a small concrete slab in his house.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a tailoring business; he sells at the market and from home to his neighbors. Anthony faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a big tailoring school in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase cloth materials for his tailoring business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Ngep

texts.en:
Ngep is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is married to Tal who works as a rice farmer. This humble couple has given birth to three children who live under their care. Ngep is a dentist who presently runs a dental business and earns about 4 USD each day. 

Since she lacks capital, Ngep is requesting a loan to purchase some dental materials. To improve her living standards, she has decided to request this loan through the Kiva partner HKL. Her loan will be very useful for her business because she thinks new materials will attract many clients. In the future, Ngep hopes to have a comfortable house and send her children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase dental materials

loans.name: Elison

texts.en:
Elison is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Elison has been working hard to manage his small pharmacy, which sells medicine to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Elison has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for his shop, and will help him generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Elison is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his shop.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace como 20 años adquirió un terreno al cual fue construyendo poco a poco 2 cuartos para comenzar a vivir el y su familia. En este momento el se ve en la necesidad de construir un cuarto mas, por que son 6 de familia, 4 hijos mas Esteban y su esposa por lo que el espacio esta mu y reducido para la casa en la que viven. Esteban quiere ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio, comodidad y estabilidad económica por tal motivo trabaja como chofer en el municipio para poder cubrir los gastos. El cuarto que quiere comenzar ya lo había planeada pero por un y otro gasto no lo ha podido realizar por eso pide el apoyo para comprar cemento, arena, block, varilla y pagar mano de obra y de esta manera el tendrá mayor espacio.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban is a hardworking gentleman. Twenty years ago, he acquired a piece of land on which he gradually built two rooms where he and his family could start living. At the moment, he needs to build another room because there are six people in his family, which includes four children plus Esteban and his wife. There is very little space in the house where all of them can live.

Esteban wants to offer his children a better inheritance in addition to comfort and financial stability. For this reason, he works as a chauffeur in town in order to cover the expenses. The room that he wants to start building has already been planned out, but he is not able to cover other expenses. Therefore, he needs assistance with buying cement, sand, blocks, lumber, as well as pay for labor so that he can have more space.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building another room.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, 33, is diligent and a good mother of two school-age children. She lives with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom. She helps her husband to earn a living by raising some pigs behind her house. She works tirelessly in order to raise and encourage her children for a brighter future. She said that she doesn’t want her children to do farming or become pig raisers as she has; she wishes to see them have well-paid jobs after they graduate from the university. 

Ly's husband Mr. Him works as a firewood seller. He uses an old buffalo to haul the firewood for selling through the commune and the market of the province. The family’s main income depends on Ly’s husband’s business, with which he can yield around $5.50 USD per day.

Mrs. Ly is now applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva for 4,000,000 Cambodia riels (KHR) to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband's business. She is thankful and confident that she will pay her loan back to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Maksatgul's Group

texts.en:
Maksatgul is the leader of this group. She is 29 and married to a builder, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters. The older daughter studies at school, and the other daughters are preschool age. 

In order to earn money, Maksatgul breeds cattle and sells dairy products. She also cultivates agricultural products and sells some each month. In this way, she earns about 5000 soms per month. Maksatgul has saved some money, but she needs more to purchase a cow. This is why she is applying for a loan. In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 53 years old, married and has 10 children between 11 and 32 years old.

Esperanza and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Esperanza helps by selling her husband's catch at her town's market. According to Esperanza, they earn about 7,000 PHP per month with their fishing business.

Esperanza has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help Esperanza and her husband earn better.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single, 23 year old woman.  She sells clothes to make a living and employs two people to assist her. 

Pauline has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy skirts, blouses and trousers for resale. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet for her business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been in training to learn more about business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard has been supplying household items to the small shops in Ruaka for the last five years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 26 years old, married to Mary, and the father of one child.

Leonard is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 30,000, from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to add stocks of sweets and soaps to sell wholesale.

He hopes to save any additional profits to open a storefront from which he will sell his goods. Leonard hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: 2 De Agosto Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento 2 de Agosto, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona del kilometro 9,  cuentan con negocio y actividad propia,   la Presidenta  es la Sra. Roxana de 23 años de edad, vive en la zona del kilometro 9 hace 4 años su  actividad es la venta  de cosméticos de manera ambulante visita distintas oficinas y barrios  ofreciendo sus productos, se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años con Estado civil convive con el sr. Freddy quien  es moto taxista y tienen 1 hijo pequeño a su cargo, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos por mayor ya que estas fiestas de fin año tiene mucha demanda ya que tiene que entregar pedidos, y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo .                                                                                                                                                                                                         Los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo, para poder crecer en sus negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The “2nd of August” Bank of Undertaking, composed of 8 individuals who live in the zone of Kilometer 9, each with her own business or activity, is in its 2nd loan cycle. The President is Roxana, 23 years of age, who has lived in the Kilometer 9 zone for some 4 years. She sells cosmetics door to door. Roxana visits distinct offices and barrios offering her products. She has been in this activity for 2 years. Roxana is  married to Freddy who is a moto-taxi driver and they have 1 little boy in their care.

With the loan Roxana will purchase cosmetics at wholesale since end-of-the-year celebrations create much demand. She must deliver orders and to do this, she needs to increase her working capital.

The borrowers are very grateful to our organization for having confidence in them and offering aid to make it possible to grow their businesses and activities.

loans.use: buy cosmetics at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en: Mr. Bayarbat is 21 years old and earns a living by selling wood that people use as fuel. He lives with his wife and his children in Kherlen, a town on the Mongolian border. Every winter his income increases because the weather is so cold, and he devotes his summers to cutting wood and preparing it for sale when the cold weather arrives. He is applying for a loan to buy a large amount of wood to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Juanita Araceli

texts.es: Juanita de 32 años está casada con Carlos de 30 años tiene 2 dos niñas de 10 y 9 años de edad Juanita ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar con la venta de dulces, chicharrones en su mismo domicilio desde hace 1 año, ella requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía como los dulces, galletas, frituras, jugos, y de esta manera poder ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos que le permitan a ella tener mayores ventas para poder reinvertir en el negocio y al mismo tiempo generar mayores ingresos para apoyar a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old, she is married to Carlos who is 30 years old and they have 2 daughters aged 10 and 9. Juanita has helped her husband with the household expenses by selling sweets and "chicharrones" [pork cracklings] from her home for the last year. 

She needs help to buy supplies such as sweets, biscuits, fried food and juices. This will help her be able to offer her clients a variety of products which will allow her to have higher sales and be able to reinvest in her business and at the same time generate higher income to support the economy of her home.

loans.use: to buy chicharrones [pork cracklings], sweets, biscuits and other products.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora María de Lourdes es una señora  humilde que desde pequeña ha trabajado para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años, ella nos  cuenta que lo que más le gusta  es atender bien  a sus clientes  y ofrecerle una buena mercancía.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace un año y a ala venta de gelatinas.
Es madre soltera pero gracias a dios a podido salir adelante con su hijo.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compara de  mas ropa para dama, caballero, niños.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla para que pueda continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
María de Lourdes is a humble lady who since she was young, has worked to give her son a better future.

She has worked selling clothes for the past 2 years.  She tells us that what she likes most is attending to her customers and offering them good merchandise.

She also has worked selling food for a year as well as gelatins.

She is a single mother, but thanks to God, she has been able to help her son get ahead.

She requests the loan for the purchase of more clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children.

She gives thanks to the foundation for supporting her so that she can continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, pues con mucho esfuerzo a sacado a su familia adelante. Fernando se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 niños a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Fernando es empleado de una mensajería donde trabaja como mensajero, y al mismo tiempo tiene un negocio de videojuegos en su casa el cual atiende su esposa en los momentos que Fernando se encuentra ausente. Fernando actualmente busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio, de modo que pueda separar por medio de una reja su casa del negocio de los videojuegos. 
Fernando espera que de esta manera su negocio pueda estar más atractivo para los clientes, y así pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio para ellos. Además, Fernando espera que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y pueda acceder a mayores oportunidades de progreso.

loans.use: Realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio, de modo que pueda separar por medio de una reja su casa del negocio de los videojuegos.

loans.name: Vanleng

texts.en: Vanleng, 47, is a widow with three children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her oldest son working together making and selling rice noodle in the local market, typically making US$10 in income each day.Vanleng would like a loan of US$800 to purchase wood to finish her construction.

loans.use: purchase wood to finish her construction.

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en: Mrs.Munhzul is 44 years old and lives her husband and her two children in own old small house in Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband herdsman, her son goes to the secondary school and her daughter goes to the kindergarten. She started own her shoes retail trade business in 2005. She sales shoes for woman, children and man. Her husband helps her own shoes trade business sometimes. She is calm and friendly woman. She plans include expanding trade center and adding new styles and sizes of shoes. There for she is requesting 2,200,000 MNT Her goal is to prepare her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To expand her  trade center and to add new styles and sizes of shoes

loans.name: Beche

texts.fr: Beche est un homme de 48 ans marié père de 4 enfants. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 9 ans déjà, il fait aussi la broderie et le surfilage mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour cela qu'il sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter deux machines( une à coudre et l'autre pour le surfilage. ce qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, il pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Beche is a married 48-year-old father of four. After his training, he opened a small sewing shop that has been doing well for nine years already. He also does embroidery and finishing, but doesn't have all the [necessary] equipment to complete his orders faster and meet his customers' [needs] on time. This is why he is seeking a loan to purchase two machines (one sewing machine and a finishing machine), which will allow him to avoid going to the market all the time, [since] he will be able to sew and resell to his customers. The profits from this loan will not only allow him to purchase his sewing equipment in order to expand his business, but will also allow him to meet some of his needs, as well as those of his small family.

loans.use: To buy 2 used sewing machines

loans.name: Georgette Afiavi

texts.fr: Mariée à un menuisier du nom de Joseph et mère de sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge, Georgette Afiavi est âgée de 39 ans. Georgette Afiavi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Georgette Afiavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Georgette Afiavi subvient ensemble avec son mari aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Georgette Afiavi vend du charbon de bois et divers autres produits depuis vingt ans et cette  activité lui permet de de faire face aux diverses charges de sa famille. Georgette Afiavi s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Georgette Afiavi sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon de bois et des divers produits.

loans.name: Luz Elida

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 46 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 1 hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 1 año se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de un amigo, así genera los recursos suficientes para su hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina fileteadora e insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Luz manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: comprar una maquina fileteadora e insumos al por mayor como telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with 6 children. She is now 61 years old. She has been in sagana for more than 6 years. She is an active group member, has borrowed and serviced 6 loans, the latest being $300.

She runs a retail shop in her own premises at Sagana town. She started her shop 6 years ago and she is also a farmer. She grows vegetables, maize and beans both for sale as well as for home use. Her retail business is doing well and manages to make sales of up to $10 per day. She makes profit of about $58 per month and this supports her family. However, the business is not fully stocked because she doesn’t have enough funds. This loan will boost her business because customers tend to buy from well stocked shops.

loans.use: Rebecca will use the loan to stock her shop with the following products sugar, flour, cooking fat & detergents.

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en: Latafat is an IDP from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled from Agdam in 1993 and moved to Baku city. She started her trading business in 1999 with her own money. In 2000 she received a  Normicro loans and expanded her business slightly. Then she received more loans and strengthened her business. Now she borrows $1200 to increase the variety of her business goods .

loans.use: She wants a Normicro loan to obtain a better variety of goods.

loans.name: Foai

texts.en:
When Foai heard about the SBPD program, she thought that it was a good opportunity for her and her family to get into fishing as a business and see whether they could achieve success. Foai is now operating a successful fishing business. Her husband goes out to sea to fish, and she sells the fish directly to the people in the village or at the fish market.

Foai’s family now has a fishing boat, which was financed by loans from SPBD. Her husband goes out to fish six days a week, if the weather permits. The least Foai realizes from her sales is never less than $600ST a week. Foai’s savings passbook shows that she saves more than the usual person in business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing equipment and tools

loans.name: Korneliya

texts.en: Korneliya R. specializes in gifts, souvenirs, and decorative household items. A true entrepreneur, Korneliya saw an opportunity to develop a business that caters to tourists and visitors to Mukachevo, Ukraine, where she operates her business. Her unique kiosk faces little direct competition and has grown over the six years she has been in business. Korneliya is friendly and lively and has developed an excellent reputation among clients and tourists. She is attentive to the needs of her customers and professional in working with her creditors. Due to previous loans through Nadiya Ukraine, Korneliya has been able to increase her inventory and successfully expand her business. As such, she has helped her husband Ivan to provide a better standard of living for their family of four. Currently, Korneliya is seeking a loan for $1,100. This loan will help her to increase the variety of her inventory. With the additional profits, Korneliya hopes to increase her working capital and purchase a car.

loans.use: Increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 35 years old. He married Dionisia 2 years ago, though he adds that they have lived together for the past 15 years. His wife is 36 years old. She is a housewife who dedicates herself to raising their three children, ages 13, 6, and 3 years old. Their oldest son is in 8th grade and their second son will soon be in first grade.

Carlos is a mechanic and runs a shop out of his house. He learned the trade at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business.

He mentions that a year ago, his wife underwent surgery and he had to sell some of his equipment to pay for her medical care. Once the family overcame that situation, he was able to return to his work thanks to much effort and dedication. He dreams of opening a larger shop where he can better attend to his clientele and incorporate the sale of parts for all types of vehicles.

He always uses loans to invest in the purchase of tools. This time, he needs to buy soldering equipment which will cost approximately $300 USD.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 35 años, está casado con Dionisia hace 2 años pero comenta que conviven juntos desde hace 15 años aproximadamente. Su esposa que ahora tiene 36 años es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado y la educación de sus 3 hijos de 13, 6 y 3 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos cursa el 8vo. Grado de la secundaria y el segundo ya va al primer grado de la primaria.

Carlos es mecánico de profesión y tiene un taller mecánico que funciona en su casa propia. Comenzó trabajando en un taller ajeno en donde aprendió todo lo que sabe hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de montar el suyo propio.

Comenta que hace un año su esposa tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente razón por la cual tuvo que vender varias de sus herramientas para costear todos los gastos que demandó dicha intervención. Una vez superada dicha situación logró remontar nuevamente su trabajo, gracias a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Sueña con levantar alguna vez un tinglado en donde podrá atender mejor a su clientela además de incorporar la venta de repuestos para vehiculos de todo tipo.

Siempre recurre a los préstamos los cuales invierte en la compra de herramientas, en esta oportunidad necesita adquirir una soldadura cuyo costo es de aproximadamente U$S 300.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.ru:
Even though Tulganoi is 57 years old, she sells her wares in the local market. It is the main source of income for her family. She has 4 children. Two of her children help Tulganoi with her business. The assortment of the products she sells include all necessary items for a home as well as children’s toys and gift sets. Her oldest son (in the picture above) travels to buy her inventory while Tulganoi and her daughter sell them in the market. A year ago Tulganoi received a loan from MicroInvest. Since then she has been an active client of MicroInvest. She wants a new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Несмотря на свои 57 лет Тулганой выходит на базар торговать. Торговля составляет основной источник дохода семьи. У нее 4 детей. Двое из них выходят помогать матери. Ассортимент ее товаров включает все необходимое для дома, а также детские игрушки и подарочные наборы. За товаром ездит ее старший сын (на фото), а Тулганой и ее дочь торгуют на рынке. Год назад она получила займ в Микроинвест и с тех пор постоянно сотрудничает. Новый займ пойдет на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
In the Santa Clara market in the middle of Ayacucho, Perú, Lilia sits on a stool behind a mountain of fresh vegetables and grains. For the past 10 years, Lilia, or “Liliana,” as her friends and neighbors know her, has been selling carrots, celery, tomatoes, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, and just about every other vegetable imaginable to her community in this small Andean city.

Before there were vegetables, there were cereals. These Lilia also sold and continues to sell in the market from her stand. The cereals consist of everything from wheat to barley, and they come from the country just outside the city limits. After several years of selling only cereals, it was clear to Lilia that she was not making enough profit to support a healthy lifestyle. Thus, she decided she needed to increase the variety of products she sold in order to supplement her income. This she did, and it is now to vegetables that she dedicates the majority of her time and energy. She happily reports that her decision was a great success, and she now serves a large number of regular customers counting on her for their daily supply of leafy greens and cereals. It is a very important business concept, explains Lilia. If one does not provide a variety of products, the customers will shop elsewhere.

This motivated 27 year-old has many goals and aspirations for her growing vegetable business. She says she is always looking for ways to improve, and she has her eye set on a permanent stand within the market. Currently, Lilia is an “ambulante,” which means she sells from a mobile stand and spends most of the day walking. A permanent stand would allow her greater consistency and the supply of a much greater quantity of products. This is an especially important time for Lilia to be expanding her business as she is newly pregnant with her first child. Thanks to her village bank, such expansion is a real possibility. For the past 3 years, Lilia has learned how to save her money and she says thanks to her bank, she has increased exponentially the amount of products she is able to move daily. Lilia is requesting a loan of $550. With this money, she will buy larger quantities of cereals and vegetables, especially carrots.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cereals and vegetables, especially carrots

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mr. Lach C., 34, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Bathambong province Cambodia. He works as a motor-taxi driver, making around $3 each day. His wife works selling grocery products in her community, making about $5 per day. One of her children is self employed as a motor-taxi driver and the rest are enrolled in school. Mr. Lach C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace his old one, which frequently needs repairs. He believes the new motor-bike will save him and his family much more money. He will use another part of the loan to purchase more grocery products for his wife to meet her customer demands. ( His wife is pictured with her grocery stand while Mr. Lach C. was on his way to operate his business).

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and her husband works as a driver. They have 5 children who all attend school. The oldest of her daughters, helps her take care of the other children and the business in the afternoons, and attends highschool in the mornings.

Juana has a small dispensary in her house which she opened several years ago. She sells all kinds of every day items such as sugar, flour, noodles, fruits and vegetables, sodas, dairy products, cookies, and various household products. She began with very little capital and now has a larger business which is much better stocked.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more merchandise for her store.

Juana es una mujer casada, su marido es chofer de una línea de transporte, tienen cinco hijos todos aun están en edad escolar, la mayor de sus hijas, la ayuda por las tardes a atender a los niños y el negocio ya que por las mañanas asiste al colegio.

Juana posee una despensa en su casa que lo abrió hace varios años, en el mismo vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad, como azúcar harina, fideos, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, productos enlatados, golosinas, galletitas dulces, productos para la casa, entre otras cosas. Ella empezó con un muy pequeño capital y hoy día ya posee un negocio mas grande y surtido.

El crédito que solicita la señora será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL STORE, SUCH AS FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, NOODLES, AND VARIOUS HOUSEHOLD ITEMS.  THE SMALL DISPENSARY SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME HELPS SUPPORT HER 5 CHILDREN.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuthea R. and her husband have been married since 1998. They have two sons; one is studying in primary school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

She and her husband have been in the business of raising pigs and ducks since 2003. They raise almost one hundred pigs on the farm behind their house. Besides the raising of pigs and ducks, they also raise fish.

Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1200. She will use this money to purchase additional feed and to repair her mother's house.

loans.use: To purchase feed and house repairs

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia, Elvira and Karina have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 1 year, 4 months and 4 months respectively. They learned to be responsible, punctual and mainly to save.

Sofia is 32 years old with 3 children. Sofia and her husband have a small mechanical heavy machinery shop. In addition, Sofía is planning on starting a new business of selling machinery parts.

Elvira is 19 years old and single. Elvira sells clothes. She brings them from Lima. Additionally Elvira and her sister buy toys wholesale and resale them in street fairs.

Karina is 24 years old and has 1 son. Karina buys chickens from the farms and sells them in the fairs. Karina is working on having her own farm.

Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

The dreams of Sofía, Elvira and Karina are that their children would go to college, to build their own house and to have a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 1 año, 4 meses, 4 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y puntuales.

Sofía es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Sofía junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico de maquinaria pesada. Además Sofía iniciará un nuevo negocio de venta de repuestos en un local alquilado.

Por otro lado Elvira es soltera y tiene 19 años, Elvira vende ropa, sus productos son traídos de la ciudad de Lima. Además por campaña trae juguetes que vende junto a su hermana en la feria de las Nazarenas.

Mientras que Karina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Karina vende pollos para criar, los compra en las granjas y los vende en las ferias. Karina esta implementando su propia granja.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 400 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, pantalones, pollos bebes y para los útiles de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Sofía, Elvira y Karina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa, tener una tienda propia y una granja.

loans.use: Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina is a very diligent woman, joyful and friendly, for many years she worked at countless activities in order to generate enough income for her beloved family. Nonetheless none of the jobs earned as much as she would have liked, and so at the invitation of one of her friends she decided to sell beauty products through catalogs. At first this business did not seem very profitable, but as she expanded her market base offering her products in other cities, things began to change. Now Peregrina has made this business her major source of income and that of her family. In this opportunity, seeing the large amount of requests that she obtains from month to month and the supply of cosmetics maintained, she would like to take advantage of this by acquiring the products in order to have them in stock and sell them at convenient prices. Your support will allow Peregrina’s hopes to become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Peregrina, es una mujer muy diligente, alegre y amigable, durante muchos años se dedicó a innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos suficientes para su amada familia, sin embargo ninguna de las labores que desempeñaba cubrían sus expectativas, es así que por invitación de una de sus amigas decidió vender productos de belleza a través de catálogos, en un principio este negocio no parecía ser tan rentable, pero conforme ampliaba su mercado ofreciendo sus productos en otras ciudades las cosas empezaron a cambiar.Actualmente doña Peregrina hizo de este negocio su más importante ingreso económico y la de su familia, en esta oportunidad viendo la gran cantidad de solicitudes que obtiene mes a mes y la oferta que mantienen los productos cosméticos desea aprovechar en adquirirlos para tenerlos en stock y venderlos a precios cómodos.Tu aporte permitirá concretar los deseos de Peregrina.

loans.use: Capital increase to acquire more products

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario M. D. ValverD.'s main business is an internet and Entel Point (telephone calls). She is a single mother and is in charge of paying for her son's education. For this reason she continues working so that she can help him get ahead. She lives in a house with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA MARIA ROSARIO M. D. VALVERD. TIENE COMO PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD SERVICIO D. INTERNET Y PUNTO ENTEL (LLAMADAS TELEFÓNICAS), LA SEÑORA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE A SU CARGO LA EDUCACION D. SU HIJO POR EL CUAL ELLA SIGUE TRABAJANDO PARA PODERLE SACAR ADELANTE ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA D. SUS PADRES

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Houk

texts.en:
Houk T., 47, is married and lives with her five children in Siem Reap Province, where she works in a grocery store and her husband works in security. Their combined revenue is above $50, but their profits are low and the cost of living is high. They are also supported by one of their children who sells souvenirs by the temple.

Inflation has driven up prices across Cambodia, and even attaining basic necessities such as food and gasoline have become daily struggles for many people. Houk T. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $300 to purchase more groceries for her store. She feels that this sustainable investment will help increase her profits and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Kossi Jean

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Jean S. was born on August 16, 1972 in the town of Tohoun, located at the center of the prefect (district) of Mono. He is married and the father of four (4) children. In 2003 he opened a store selling basic grocery items in the Agoe neighborhood of Lome. He has five (5) years experience in this business and always responds to the needs of his customers.

To increase his stock and insure that he has adequate supplies, Mr. S. is requesting his first business loan to purchase four (4) cans of oil, six (6) sacks of rice, eight (8) cartons of milk and fifteen (15) cartons of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Kossi Jean est né la 16 août 1972 à Tohoun dans la préfecture de moyen Mono. Il est marié et père de quatre (5) enfants. En 2003, il a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Avec cinq années d’expérience dans ce commerce, il répond toujours aux besoins de ses clients. Pour augmenter son stock et éviter les ruptures de stock, monsieur S. Kossi Jean sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 bidons d’huile, 6 sacs de riz, 8 cartons de lait et 15 cartons de spaghetti.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery products

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suwardi

texts.id:
Verging on 49 years of age, Ni Ketut Suwardi is keen about developing her livestock business that she began six months ago. With a sufficiently permanent stable and two pigs for breeding, Ni Ketut Suwardi has already gained respectable earnings of Rp.1.000.000 (approx. US$109) in six months. However, Ni Ketut Suwardi has not had an opportunity to develop her business further with these earnings because she has been facing rising prices driven by increased gas prices. As a result, Ni Ketut Suwardi is eager for additional working capital from DINARI Foundation which can help her purchase feed and expand the number of her livestock.

Ni Ketut Suwardi not only works diligently on her business but also daily helps her husband in his work as a farmer. She does all this to sustain the family and finance their three kids. Although Ni Ketut Suwardi and her husband have not studied past elementary school, they yearn for all their children to undergo higher education. Developing this livelihood business, Ni Ketut Suwardi wishes to realize her dream of schooling her children to the highest level.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Memasuki usia ke 49 tahun Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat bersemangat dalam mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang baru dirintisnya sejak 6 bulan yang lalu. Dengan bermodalkan sebuah kandang yang cukup permanen dan 2 ekor ternak peliharaan, Ni Ketut Suwardi sudah mendapatkan keuntungan yang cukup lumayan yaitu Rp. 1.000.000.- / 6 bulan. Namun, belum sempat Ni Ketut Suwardi dapat mengembangkan usahanya dengan hasil keuntungan yang di peroleh , kini dia telah di hadapkan dengan permasalahan kenaikan harga barang-barang karena pengaruh kenaikan BBM ( Bahan Bakar Minyak ). Oleh karena itu Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat berharap bisa mendapatkan tambahan modal dari Dinari yang akan dipergunakan untuk menambah modal baik dalam pembelian bibit maupun untuk biaya pakannya , sehingga jumlah peliharaanya akan lebih banyak.
