Dalam keseharianya Ni Ketut Suwardi sangat tekun dalam usaha maupun membantu pekerjaan suami yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani. Semua itu dia lakukan untuk menyambung hidup dan membiayai ke tiga orang anaknya. Meskipun hanya tamatan Sekolah Dasar, Ni Ketut Suardi dan Suami sangat merindukan semua anaknya bisa mengenyam pendidikan yang lebih tinggi . Dengan mengembangkan usaha ternak ini , besar harapan Ni Ketut Suwardi untuk dapat mewujudkan impiannya menyekolahkan anak bungsunya sampai ketingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia Z. D. C. tiene 52 años y vive en la Avenida Quiñigon  sin número sector Miramar D. distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad  Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres eran personas muy pobres y ella desde muy pequeña tuvo que empezar a ayudarlos a trabajar.
Se casó con el señor Birilo C. con el que tuvo cuatro hijos, pero solo dos dependen de ella económicamente.
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores y compra venta de trigo o menestra de la estación, lo que puede venderlo en grano o en harina, manifiesta que vender el trigo en harina cuesta más y su ganancia es mayor. Su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles para ser devueltos en cuatro  meses, compró cuyes y gallinas a muy buen precio y los vendió ganando muy bien.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual pagara en 4 cuotas, comprará dos cerdos y dos ovejas.
Julia sueña con conocer el Perú de norte a sur. 
Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
texts.en:
Julia Zaveleta D. Castilo is 52 years old and lives on Quinigon Avenue in Miramar, a town in the Otuzco province of La Libertad, Peru. Julia is a member of the Communal Bank of Women of Mache and dreams for seeing all of Peru, from north to south. Julia finished 3rd grade and then went to work with her parents. She was unable to continue studying because her parents were very poor. Julia later married Birilo C. and had four children. Two of their children still depend on their parents for support and the other two have moved on. Julia works out of her home as a trader. She specializes in buying and selling agricultural products such as small animals and grain. She sells grain in both seed form and flour form (flour earns better profits). Julia has taken out one loan from Manuela Ramos previously. The first loan was for S/. 300 (apx. $100) and was repaid within four months. Julia used the funds to purchase guinea pigs and chickens at a very low price, which she later resold at a good profit. Julia is now requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 ($675). She will similarly repay this loan in four months and plans to purchase two hogs and two lambs.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hogs and lambs.

loans.name: Sothavy's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan, and there are four group members. Mrs. Sothavy Thom is one member of the group, and she was selected to be the group leader. Sothavy is 24 years old, and she grows vegetables on her farmland (behind her house) and later sells the vegetables at the market. By doing so, she earns approximately US$4 per day. In addition, Sothavy is married to Mr. Mak Orn; they do not have any children. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops. The other three group members are as follows:

1 Mrs. Sokhem P. grows vegetables to sell, and she also requests a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable crops;

2 Mrs. Chantha T. grows vegetable crops, and she seeks a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase fertilizer; and

3 Mr. Noeum C. has a rice mill, and he requests a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase rice to then grind for sale.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops

loans.name: Dzouéra

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Takoura, Madame A. Dzouéra est mère d’un enfant. Très tôt elle entre en apprentissage pour vite subvenir à ses besoins. Couturière de profession, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour s’acheter des machines à coudre ce qui fait que sa seule machine ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les commandes de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50.000 F pour acquérir une nouvelle machine et mieux être à la hauteur de son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Takoura, Mrs. Dzouéra A. is the mother of one child. Early on, she learned a job to provide for herself. A trained seamstress, she lacks financial means to buy sewing machines, and her only machine does not enable her to meet customer demand. She's seeking a loan of XOF 50'000 to purchase a new machine and to improve her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. M. is 34 years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are in school in Rongo, Kenya.

Teresa has been selling second hand clothing in Rongo since 2006. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings in order to purchase more second hand clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa P., 56, is married with 7 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (about $312 USD).  SPBD loans are Sa’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, weedkiller chemical, and taro tops for planting

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin N., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sreytouch Phan, 30, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, have been married for ten years and have three children: two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school.

Sophoin has been growing vegetables for eight years. He also buys them from the villagers in his village for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. His wife has been raising ducks for ten years, a skill she learned by herself. Sophoin and his wife hope to set up their own shop to sell food and rice. Sophoin is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a trailer to carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to carry vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nhao

texts.en:
A farmer in Chen village in Takeo Province, Mr. Nhao Y. owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living. Because his soil is now infertile, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the land and fuel to operate his irrigation system. He will use the remainder of the loan to hire laborers to work in his field.

Nhao is 50 years old and the father of six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Kel Choeurn, shown on the left in the photo, is a chicken breeder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his land and fuel for his irrigation system, and to hire laborers to work on his field.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia T. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children -- two males and two females -- who are all currently in the basic school. Her husband is a palm nut farmer. Cecelia lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities.

Cecelia produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms to add to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail.

She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She aspires to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Adela María

texts.es:
La señora Adela C. habita en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que ha sido levantada producto de sus esfuerzos ya que se ha dedicado grandemente para sacar adelante su negocio.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito porque requiere invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los productos de pulpería para ofertarlos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Adela C. lives in the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. She tends her own general store which has been built as a product of her endeavours, as she has greatly devoted herself to carry on her business. Despite the difficult financial situations she has come through, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan because she needs to invest in her business by means of the purchase of general store merchandise to offer it for sale in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela cuenta 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar papas y alverjas, durante estos meses de cosecha hay bonanza por lo que trata de acumular sus ingresos económicos, para utilizarlos como capital en los próximos cultivos de papa. A las 4.00am Adela inicia sus labores de ama de casa, después, a las 9.00am alista sus viandas donde carga el almuerzo de su esposo y el suyo para ir a trabajar a sus chacras. En esta época la siembra de papas les ha sido muy rentable, porque en el mercado les han cotizado a un buen precio, lo que la anima a seguir sembrando, las papas que nos muestra en la foto son de un tamaño seleccionado que tienen un precio mayor, y generalmente son enviados a los mercados de Lima por ser mucho más rentables. Adela está muy feliz con su actividad, tiene grandes anhelos de progresar a base de la agricultura y brindarles comodidad a su familia e hijos. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y que en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy eficiente y puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando es para mandar a arar con tractor su chacra descansada (sin producir) de hace varios años, y con otra parte comprará insecticidas contra los gusanos.
texts.en:
Adela is 32 years old, lives with her partner and father of their 3 children. Together with her husband they plant potatoes and peas, during these harvesting months there is enough prosperity to build their income, in order to use the capital in the next round of potato crops. At 4:00 AM Adela begins her work as a housewife, after, at 9:00AM she prepares food for packed lunches for her and her husband to take while working their farmlands. Right now potato planting is very profitable, because of the good market price, which encourages her to continue planting. The potatoes shown in the photo are of the selected size that fetches the highest price, and are generally sent to the markets in Lima to be more profitable.

Adela is very happy with this activity, and has high hopes to progress on the basis of agricultural and provide more comfort for her family and children. This is her 9th loan with MFP, and all this time she has shown that she is a very punctual and efficient customer in her payments. The money she requests now is to buy a tractor to plow her farmland that has been unproductive for many years, and the other part will buy insecticides against worms.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a tractor to plow their farmland.

loans.name: Neba Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a mother of two children. She runs a business buying and selling cocoyams in the Bamenda food market. Comfort will use this loan to buy 150,000 CFA worth of cocoyams (taro), which she will house in a market stall she rents. She will also use the loan to pay for transporting her cocoyams.

This is Comfort’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. She has been successful at selling her cocoyams because of her approach to attracting customers and her friendly demeanor. She also notes that keeping her stall clean, as well as providing quality cocoyams keeps her business running.

At age 25, Comfort has already experienced the loss of her father and has had to drop out of school and take care of her younger siblings and her children. She plans to use the profits of this loan to improve her standard of living, pay for her children’s school fees and help take care of her younger siblings. Comfort takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loan work well for her and her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Neba Comfort  from  Cameroon

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, pay stall rent and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
In Ukraine many people prefer shopping in the market. Irina is one of the market vendors who serve these clients. After trying out a couple of other business ventures, she found that she liked selling retail items the most. She credits her success to finding a good market opportunity and to receiving timely financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine.”  Her integrity and hard-working attitude have allowed her to establish her business and keep it stable.  Presently, Irina earns about 8,000 Grivnyas each month. 

After 15 years in business, Irina is requesting a loan of 15,000 Gryvnias in order to stock her retail space with new inventory, which she will be able to purchase in bulk. Irina and her husband Andrei are the proud parents of two daughters. Her desire is to increase her productivity and raise her net income so that she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase merchandise inventory.

loans.name: Anwar Muhammad Noor Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her bicycle-repairing business.

Razia baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her decorative-embroidery business.

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a lathe. 

Anwar baji belongs to a conservative family. Her society was against educating girls and her parents were forced to conform. She feels being deprived of knowledge a blessing but she decided that this shouldn’t happen to her children. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Her children are very happy with her. Anwar baji operates a business sewing clothes to pay her children’s school fees.

Anwar baji married M. N. who is a salesman and sells bakery items. She is applying for a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits & chips) wholesale so that her husband is able to sell them to the grocery shops and increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy bakery items wholesale to sell

loans.name: Soumayé

texts.fr: Soumaye S. est une dame de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait déjà du commerce de divers comme succre, riz poisson fumé. elle aimerait promouvoir son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Soumaye S., 49, is married and the mother of 6 children. She already sells various items such as sugar, rice, and smoked fish. She would like to bolster her little business so as to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of sugar, rice, and smoked fish

loans.name: Everlyne Nafula

texts.en: Everlyne S. is a modest businesswoman in Kakamega Town, Western Kenya. She is married to Harrison and they have two school-going children aged eight and four years. Everlyne presently sells various types of fish in Bukembe Market to earn a living. Fish is a popular dish in Western Kenya, and she has seen a remarkable growth in her business since she started it three years ago. Everlyne is taking her second loan from KADET and she intends to use it to purchase more fish stock. She wants to see further growth in her business to enable her to diversify into farming activities. For now she is happy that she can afford to educate her two children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more fish stock

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
Sherlie S. is from the town of Panaon. She is 30 years old. Sherlie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Sherlie owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Sherlie has has her business for over four years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sherlie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Sherlie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Sherlie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: John Mugo

texts.en:
John C. is 34-years-old, married to Mary and they have two children. He has been in the vehicle repairs business for the past 15 years now. His business is located along Eldoret- kisumu highway road and his clients include farmers and residences within Eldoret Town.

John was a founder of a group and he was among the first clients of KADET.With the loan he is taking from KADET he intends to buy a cylinder and pistons.

In future he wants to grow his business to a large manufacturing shop and to diversify by opening another branch at Kapsabet town 62 km from Eldoret Town.



About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts which include pistons.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. San Juan D. Tahuaco del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 09 hijos y No tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, vive en la comunidad D. san Juan D. Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una D. las socias fundadoras,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado mayor para engorD., también trabajo con su criadero D. truchas con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades den los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia S. de 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, con una hija de 13 años que estudia la secundaria, sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa, ya que todavía su piso es de suelo, le falta repellar paredes y desea tener una casa digna para su familia. Anteriormente vendía productos de cosméticos pero las ventas se pusieron bajas y no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos lo cual busco un empleo fijo y ahora trabaja de conserje en un colegio americano para tener su salario fijo y poder cubrir sus gastos, a un vende cosméticos en poca proporción a sus clientes para poder mejorar su economía. Con este crédito es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de zinc y otros materiales para reparar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado. Da la gracia a la institución por el préstamo ya que hace posible hacer las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Lucrecia S. is 41 years old, and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has a 13-year old daughter who is in secondary school. Her plan is to finish construction on her house, which still has a ground floor of dirt, and is lacking plaster on the walls. She desires to have a decent home for her family. Previously, she sold cosmetics but the sales were low, and did not cover her expenses, which caused her to look for a steady job. She now works as a janitor at an American school in order to have a fixed salary and be able to cover her expenses, and she sells a small amount of cosmetics to her customers in order to improve her economic situation. This loan will begin her third cycle with AFODENIC, and will be used to purchase zinc and other materials to repair the roof of her house, which is in bad condition. She is grateful to the institution for this loan, since it will now be possible to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zinc and other materials to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Rosália Armando

texts.pt:
Rosália T. é natural de Maputo tem 29 anos de idade é solteira não tem filhos vive numa casa alugada. Frequenta a escola, neste momento esta concluindo o ensino médio.

Ela trabalha na Educação como professora a mais de 5 anos das 7h as 12h todos os dias da semana e aufere 4.700.00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum dinheiro no banco comercial, Barclays.

Foi formada pelo Centro de formação de professores de Namaacha a 6 anos.
Com este empréstimo de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção, concretamente cimento, ferro, chapas de zinco e outros.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições financeiras. Conheceu a Hluvuku pela Eva Nunes amiga dela e cliente da mesma instituição.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sendo os anteriores de 10.200.00mt e 12.000.00mt. 
O seu grande desafio é terminar a Obra e viver na sua própria casa, para tal pretende pagar bem este empréstimo e pedir mais. No futuro gostaria de levantar créditos para conclusão da obra e compra de mobiliário.
texts.en:
Rosália T. is a native of Maputo. She is 29 years old, single, does not have children, and lives in a rented house. She goes to school and is currently finishing her secondary education. She has worked in education as a teacher for more than five years, from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon every day of the week, and earns 4,700 MT which she uses for the support of her family, putting a little money aside in Barclays, the commercial bank. She graduated from the Teachers Training Centre of Namaacha six years ago. With this loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to purchase construction materials, specifically cement, iron, corrugated iron, and other things. She has never requested a loan from other financial institutions. She came to know about Hluvuku through Eva Nunes, a friend of hers and a client of this same institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, the previous ones being for 10,200 MT and 12,000 MT. Her great challenge is to finish construction and live in her own house, and for that she plans to pay this loan back and request another. In the future, she would like to raise loans to finish construction and purchase furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, corrugated iron and other materials)

loans.name: Hermane

texts.en:
Hermane P. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Hermane is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Hermane operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of banana products and other items in the local community. Hermane has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hermane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Hermane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Hermane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tevy

texts.en:
Mr. Tevy P., age 24, is single and is living with his parents in a small village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tevy has been working for a restaurant for one year. He hopes to organize his house where he lives to become neat, so he is applying for a loan of $500 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: San

texts.en: San P., 33, is married with two school-age children. She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a grocery store at home, earning $5 US per day. Her husband helps his wife with the business and he is a motorbike repairman, earning approximately $2 US per day. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of $700 US to purchase a variety of groceries to restock her store. She hopes that her plan of expanding her business will be successful so that she is able to handle more customers.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to restock the store

loans.name: Constantin

texts.en:
Constantin is 33 years old and is single. he lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here Constantin has owned a shop selling foodstuffs including cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc., since 2007 working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Constantin realized that his profit is still too low to expand meaningfully and he believes that a small amount of additional capital would change his business progressively. To do this, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. he will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs such as rice, flour, etc., so that he may attract new customers and increase his sales and (hopefully) profits as well.

With the continued success of his business, Constantin will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as saving to cover any financial problems.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, salt, sugar and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Rosemary is a fashion designer. She designs and sews dresses for sale and also for clients who place orders. She works in a shop by the road in her community. She has two apprentices under her training. Rosemary has been in business for seven years and desires to give her business a face-lift. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabric and other accessories in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabric and other accessories in bulk

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor  Silvio Rodríguez C., Labora como  Oficial Mantenimiento en el Mercado Roberto Huembés,
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los dos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción: ladrillo, cemento, etc. para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita y el pago de la mano de obra, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Silvio dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando
texts.en:
Silvio Rodríguez C. works as a maintenance officer in the Roberto Huembés market in Managua. He is married with two children, both of whom are school aged. He has acquired several loans through Kiva partner CEPRODEL over the last four years. In this time, he has applied the proceeds of five loans granted through CEPRODEL to home renovations for his residence. He is an excellent client. The requested loan will be used to purchase construction materials: bricks, cement, etc., to remodel the floor of the home in which he lives as well as to pay for manual labor. His objective is to provide better security and living conditions for his children. Silvio attests that, thanks to the loans granted through Kiva partner CEPRODEL, his home has continued to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is an educated young man who lives in Beit Hanoun, in Gaza/Palestine. His village is located in an Ottoman area near the Israeli borders. Beit Hanoun is known for beautiful citrus and almond trees, as well as for raising cattle and goats. Ahmad is only 20 years old, but very well experienced in raising his livestock. He lives with his family and is ambitious to finish his education. He requested a loan of $3000 to expand his business by buying sheep and feed and eventually a bigger hut. Ahmad is unique in his integrity and high ambitions, and there is no doubt he will succeed in his project.

loans.use: To buy sheep, expand his hut and increase production

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is a 20-year-old single lady. She owns a beauty salon in the Barisheba area in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa. Her business has been in existence for the last four years and is doing well. B. says that most of her clients are the young residents living in the area.

Esther is a member of Nadhani Nitafaulu SHG in KADET Mombasa. She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by an existing member of the group and this is her first time borrowing. She intends to use this money to purchase some beauty products and hair chemicals for the salon. She also hopes to do minor repairs and fixes in her salon to make it more appealing to her clients.

Her dream is to see her business grow and she hopes to open more beauty salons later.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair chemicals and to perform minor repairs in her salon

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata B. is 60 years old,divorced with two children, both boys. The two children are already working. Isata lives in Tegbeh town, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.

Isata sells rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken out four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans she bought the same goods for sale and used her profits to pay her children's school fees.

Isata wants to use her present loan of 1,500,000 leones to buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice, groundnuts, pepper and onions

loans.name: Thelma Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Thelma Argentina Munguia tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.Ella vende ropa de toda clase tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Ella trabaja arduamente para suplir los gastos de su hogar y la razón única por la que está solicitando el crédito hoy en día es para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa ya que la necesita a lo inmediato para continuar comercializandola y de esta manera obtener los ingresos pertinentes y sobre todo suplir la demanda de sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Thelma Argentina Munguia C. has a business in her house, which is two blocks away from the central market. She sells all types of clothing and sometimes buys clothing in bulk for adults, teens or children, depending on how much money she has saved up. She has two children, but neither of them depend on her financially. She works for herself and to cover her household expenses. This is the first loan Thelma has taken out with Ceprodel. She came to us because she was tired of working with lenders who squeeze everything out of small business owners, and so she decided to look into the loans that Ceprodel offers. She expects to keep working with us and, with God's help, to pay off her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bulk purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Azetou

texts.en: Azetou A. is 38 years old, married to a taxi driver, and has three children. She works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo, selling charcoal, millet, corn and sorgho. She purchases her supplies from the northern part of the country, and then sells her products from home in the south. This will be her third loan with Kiva partner, WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. Not only will this loan help support her business, but her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, millet, corn and sorgho

loans.name: J.temporada's Group

texts.en:
Jennie T. is from the village of Lumbayao, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Jennie is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jennie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennie owns & operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jennie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jennie is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jennie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 39 years old and lives with her husband and one teenage son in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She and her family live together in a single-roomed house.

Currently, Sajida operates a business sewing clothes while her husband is a painter. They have been operating their businesses for over fifteen years, and have steadily expanded them. Her husband, F. H., paints windows and doors and Sajida sews clothes for her neighbors. Their businesses are well known to their customers. With the profit, they purchased a color television and a fridge.

Sajida has been a client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan) for the last two years. Now she is applying for a loan for the third time to start a business selling paint. She and her husband have the expectation that the new business will give them good earnings which will help them to provide a better lifestyle to their son.

loans.use: To start a business selling paint

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una gran mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, pese a que es una persona con capacidades especiales, nos comentó que se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, que consiste en la venta de comida rápida,  para ello cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor que es quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Desde hace varios ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal Damas En Progreso, con los créditos que ha recibido por parte de la Fundación su negocio ha ido en aumento, ahora podrá invertir en arreglar el lugar donde tiene su negocio y poder comprar mas alimentos como plátanos. Queso y aceites.


A sus 58 años es una mujer bastante activa, es viuda hace 13 años y sus hijos han sido el apoyo, ellos ya son adultos y tienen sus familias; el sueño de nuestra socia es poder seguir ayudando a sus dos nietos que ella tiene a su cargo, ya que son huérfanos, y ella es la que les ha brindado el cuidado y quiere que sigan estudiando para verlos realizados.
texts.en:
Rosa is a great lady, and very hard working. She is a person with special skills - she told us she feels satisfaction in her work, which is the sale of fast food. She is helped by her eldest daughter who prepares the food. For some time, she has been a member of the Women in Progress Communal Bank. Through the loans she has received from the Foundation, her store has grown. Now she'll be able to invest in improvements to the space where she operates her shop and buy more food such as bananas, cheese, and oils. At 58 years of age, she is a very active woman. She has been a widow for 13 years and her children have provided a her with lot of support, as they are grown with families of their own. Her dream is to be able to continue helping her two orphaned grandchildren, who are in her care. She is the one who has supported and cared for them and she wants them to pursue their studies and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, meat, potatoes, bananas, cheese, vegetables

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: Mrs. Ream C., 52, is a villager who lives in Voat Svay village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns four hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Ream C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two wheels for her plowing machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. Aside from farming she also breeds pigs and ducks, which adds to the family income. Mrs. Ream C. is widow with three children: one is seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer who helps with the farm, and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase two wheels for the plowing machine and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma C., a small entrepreneur, runs a business selling fried food (chicken chips) at  Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her products (potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal) from the city market shops and then sells to her customers. The business income enables her to meet her family's daily needs and business capitalization. Mwajuma is now requesting a loan of T.shs 700,000 to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, cooking oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel R. M. de 30 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, quien reside en el departamento de La Libertad, a pesar que vive solo, Víctor es alguien quien desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan contar con una vida mejor y así mismo brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Él posee una venta de productos alimenticios como pupusas, panes, jugos, sodas, fruta, así como también diferentes tipos de golosinas y agua embotellada, su negocio esta ubicado dentro del colegio llamado Francisco Lara, en donde posee la ventaja de ser el único chalet, lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias diarias ya que vende con la mayoría de alumnos y maestros del lugar. Es por esta razón que él desea poder invertir en productos los cuales los alumnos más solicitan, así mismo incluir productos los cuales son nuevos pero que poseen muy buena demanda como golosinas y bebidas, Víctor trabaja junto a una empleada, la cual se encarga de elaborar los alimentos que comercializan y junto a ella trabajan muy duro de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. Su negocio es muy estable y así mismo le permite brindarles fuente de empleo a otras personas, es por esto que desea mucho salir adelante solicitando un préstamo a Integral a través del cual  mejore su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel R. M. is 30 years old and a hardworking gentleman. He resides in the Department of La Libertad. Despite living alone, Victor wants to improve his business so that he can earn more income to have a better life and help his parents. He has a store where he sells food products such as pupusas, bread, juices, sodas, fruit, as well as different types of candies and bottled water. His business is located next to the Francisco Lara School where he has the advantage of having the only other structure. This allows him to earn a very good daily income since he sells mostly to students and teachers. For this reason, he wants to invest in products that are most requested by the students. At the same time he also wants to include new merchandise that has high demand such as candy and soft drinks. Victor works with one employee who is charge of making the prepared foods that he sells. They both work very hard Monday through Saturday throughout the entire day. His business is very stable, so he hopes to provide employment to other people. In order to get ahead, Victor is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable products

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita E. is from the town of Surallah. She is 63 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Florita owns a business raising crops, primarily rice, for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 46 years.

Florita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Florita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Frida Marilu

texts.es:
Frida es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Frida tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, regalos, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huarakaq que significa Abundancia en quechua, lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, en este nuevo ciclo solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de bebidas, leche, aceite.
Los sueños de Frida son ampliar su negocio, tener una ferretería y ayudar a sus hijos que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Frida is married and has two children enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, gifts, and beverages. Frida manages her business every day.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Muchuy Huarakaq”, which means “Abundance” in Quechua. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is having the incentive to save. She is in her ninth loan cycle and requesting 1050 PEN to purchase beverages, milk, and oil.

Frida dreams of expanding her business, opening a hardware store, and helping her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, milk, and oil

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es: La Señora Ana  se dedica a la Siembra y cosecha de papa y otras verduras,  la señora vive en casa de su suegra, para tener corta edad la señora desde muy pequeña se dedico a la venta y comercialización de papa y otros productos, la señora vive en Colcapirhua a un kilometro y medio del barrio kami, el destino del crédito es para poder comprar mas insumos de para la siembra como ser: Semillas, abono, fertilizante. A veces la señora por las fechas de producción aprovecha también en traer juguetes, ropas y otros, la señora llego a emprender gracias a una clienta que trabaja con nosotros ya hace muchos años. Se siente feliz ya que gracias a la tasa preferencial kiva la señora mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana sows and harvests potatoes and other vegetables. She lives at her mother-in-law's. She has been selling potatoes and other produce from an early age. She lives in Colcapirhua, one and a half kilometres from the Kami neighbourhood. The loan is to purchase raw materials for the sowing, such as seeds, manure and fertiliser. Sometimes, depending on production times, she also takes the opportunity to bring toys, clothes and other items. Ana started her entrepreneurial activities thanks to a client who has been working with us for many years. She is happy because she will be able to improve her income thanks to Kiva's preferential rate.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to sow potatoes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Guido y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La actividad a la que Juliana se dedica es el cultivo de plátano, piña y café. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de La merced, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes para sus cultivos, así como insumos para combatir la plaga.
texts.en:
Juliana is 32 years old, she is a very happy and hard-working woman, she owns her home where she lives with her husband Guido. She wishes to improve her quality of life. She works harvesting bananas, pineapples, and coffee. She begins her days very early caring for her farm knowing that the more careful she is with her crops, the better product she will harvest. From her job, she likes planting the most and she does it with alot of patience. She has been doing it for 10 years and considers transporting her crops to the market in the city of La Merced, where she sells them, to be the most difficult. In time she hopes to purchase more land in order to increase her harvest. This is her third loan with MFP, she knows she has to be punctual with payments if she wants to obtain another loan in the future. She is a responsible member of her communal bank and it is the motive for being so respected by her partners. With her requested loan of 2,500 PEN ( 900 USD), she will purchase fertilizers for her crops and product to combat the plague.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and product to battle insect pests

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion P., 56, who is married to Bernard P. and the mother of their one and only child. She is a resident of Caloocan City just north of Manila on the island of Luzon. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support her child and to continue sending him all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Concepcion, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Concepcion operates a smoked-fish vending business. What she basically does is buy a quantity of fresh fish from the market and process them by smoking them until they are ready to sell. She packs these dried fish at prices ranging from 15 PHP, 30 PHP and 50 PHP depending on the quantity of fish per pack. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200-300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of fish to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Concepcion dreams of giving her child a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka tiene 26 años, es una joven que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general y tortilla. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio pues es una persona muy responsable ya que siempre ha pagado sus cuotas en tiempo.   Anielka es una mujer seria, sencilla y honesta en sus compromisos.El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de maíz, cal y leña.
texts.en:
Anielka is 26 years old.  She is a young woman who has always liked to work and earn a living in a humble way.  She sells general merchandise and tortillas.  She has had this business for four years.  

She is a very responsible person who has always made her payments on time.  Anielka is a serious and easygoing woman who is honest with her obligations.

She will use the loan to buy corn, lime powder, and firewood.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Mr. Soeu L., 42, sells rattan cupboards and beds in the province of Kompong Tom. For four years, Soeu L. and his wife have owned a handicraft business, which they run from their home. They also sell their products in bulk to middlemen who then sell them  retail at the market. The demand for their craft is very high.  Almost all of their customers need to wait a few weeks before they can meet the orders. This couple wish to own a horse cart that they can use it to transport their products in and around their community, but they don't have enough money to buy one.  Mr. Soeu L. would like to request a loan to purchase a horse cart to transport his productsl. Mr. Soeu L. was not available the day of the photo, so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase a horse cart for transport products to sell.

loans.name: Adeltrudez

texts.en:
Adeltrudez M. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin. She is 60 years old. Adeltrudez is widowed and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Adeltrudez owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Adeltrudez has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adeltrudez joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adeltrudez is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adeltrudez from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 49 años, está casada, con Ervin, de 54 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 4 años, a la que educan y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Hace tan solo dos años, que Norma sufrió la pérdida de su casa; producto de un Huaico (crecida del río, que contiene lodo y agua abundante), que gracias a la labor humanitaria de los miembros de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosa y cerveza en un pequeño negocio que acondicionó en su casa. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya que gracias a su buena sazón en la cocina, los profesores de la única escuela de su localidad, la contratan para que les prepare los alimentos del día, pues la mayoría son de otra ciudad y viven en casas alquiladas. A ella, le va muy bien en su negocio y más adelante está pensando ampliar su negocio no solo con bebidas, también abrir un restaurante, donde venda las ricas comidas que sabe preparar. Esté es el octavo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo de apoyo solidario, brindado por su banco comunal; se siente muy feliz de haber logrado sus objetivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar, varias mesas y sillas, como también insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old, and is married to Ervin who is 54 years old. They have three children, but only one of their children lives with them: Lisbet, who is 4 years old, and who they educate and raise in their own home in the Puente Paucartambo community (in the central peruvian rainforest). Only two years ago, Norma lost her house due to a Huaico (rising of the river which contained mud and too much water). Thanks to the humanitarian labor of members of her community bank, she was able to move forward.

She sells soft drinks and beer in a small business within her home. Norma does not just do this, but also, thanks to her skill in the kitchen, the teachers at the only school in her area contract her to prepare daily meals since the majority of them are from another city and live in rented houses. To her, this business is very good, and going forward, she is hoping to grow her business to not only sell drinks but also to open a restaurant, where she can sell the rich foods she knows how to prepare.

This is her eighth loan with MFP, and all this time of receiving support from her community bank, she has felt very happy to have had achieved her goals. In acquiring this loan, she hopes to purchase various tables and chairs as well as other supplies for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, chairs, and products for food preparation

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 54 years old and is married to Jane, who is a farmer. Jane contributes to meeting the couple’s daily expenses, thus allowing Stephan expand his business.  For the past 20 years, Stephen has been a photographer. 

Stephen is applying for his sixth loan with Kadet. He has successfully repaid his previous loans, which is an indication of his good business ability. He will use his current loan to buy a digital camera and will use his profit to open another photo studio. In the future, Stephen hopes and dreams of owning a large photo studio in the town center.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Nezzikokolima Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 46-year-old Grace S. has been running a poultry business for the past 6 years in Kirinya-Mukono. It is a lucrative business. This happily married mother of 4 says she began her business out of self interest. Like any other business of this nature, she has been plagued by some long drawn out problems, such as constant chicken diseases that have, in most cases, killed many of her birds. She has chosen not to despair, but has worked painstakingly hard in trying to forestall the above mentioned problems through buying medicines and improving the hygiene of her chicken house. In a way, this has helped her a lot as her chickens are now growing up healthy, sturdy and free of disease and stress. As a result, she has been able to resell more chickens to more clients. Grace belongs to Nezzikokolima development group-Mukono. She says this business generates her 120,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more chicks.

loans.use: Towards the purchase of more chicks.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence K. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are currently in school. Florence has a maize produce business, which she has run for less than a year.         
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans which she sells to restaurants and hotels. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees. In the future, Florence hopes to open more branches of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame Fanta K.  est âgée de 45 ans et vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame à Dangassa, un des villages de la préfecture  de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Fanta K. est une femme analphabète qui s’est vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle est très appréciée à Dangassa et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé ses 2 prêts précédents, elle est à son troisième  prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter,  3,5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, arachide et sésame) auprès des  producteurs. Elle vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs de Ouelessebougou et Bamako. 
Fanta K. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanta K. is 45 years old and she lives with her 6 children and her husband as a monogamous family in Dangassa. It is a village in the Kati prefecture in the region of Koulikoro. 

Fanta K. is illiterate and very early on she started her revenue-generating activities, especially the purchase and storage of cereal grains. She is well liked in Dangassa and the surrounding areas. 

In order to satisfy her ever growing clientele she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Following the successful repayment of 2 previous loans, she is now on her third individual loan. She will use it to purchase 3.5 tons of cereal grains (corn, peanuts and sesame seeds) from the producers. She sells primarily in wholesale to a clientele made up of retailers in Ouelessebougou and Bamako. 

Fanta K. expects to earn a monthly income of 75.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan and the remaining portion will be invest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristobal, de 46 años, es separado y muy responsable con sus deberes de padre, por ello  vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversos oficios, y desde hace 13 años se dedica al oficio de taxista, contando con su propio vehículo, desde entonces se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos económicos. Es así que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, de esa manera puede cubrir con la educación de su hijo, así como terminar de construir su casa. Por ello se siente muy  contento con su labor, a pesar de los peligroso que es exponerse de noche, además que dentro de esta actividad lo realiza de manera independiente.  Este emprendedor hombre, está convencido que trabajando arduamente y más la ayuda de ustedes él podrá terminar de construir su casa y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida de su hijo, además de ayudar a completar su educación. Este es el segundo crédito  que tiene con MFP, donde es un asiduo e incansable trabajador,  por ello dice “que con confíen en él y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”. Por ello con el crédito que solicita,  comprará ventanas y puertas, para mandar a poner en su casa, y con el resto del crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 46 years old, separated and a very responsible father.  He lives with his son in his own home.  From a very early age he has worked in several different jobs.  For 13 years now he has been a taxi driver and uses his own automobile.  This is the only source of income he has.  Every day he begins work very early in the morning and does not finish until late at night.  In this manner he can provide an education for his son and also finish building his house.

He is very satisfied with his job despite the perils of working at night and the fact that he works alone.  This entrepreneur is convinced that working hard and with your help he will be able to finish his house and provide a better quality of life for his son and help him finish his education.  This is his second loan through MFP where he is a constant and indefatigable worker.  He says "to trust him and rest assured that he will pay back the loan on time".  He plans to use the loan to buy windows and doors for his house and the rest for maintenance of his automobile.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows for his house and repair parts for his automobile

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 53-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Moses wishes to build a permanent house for the family and to set up an income generating activity that can sustainably provide money on a daily basis. Moses has been distilling alcohol and growing onions for 35 years. His major challenge is the price fluctuation of alcohol. Moses' dream is to own ten acres of onion garden. Moses needs this loan to plant onions.

loans.use: to plant onions

loans.name: Carlos Domingo

texts.es: Carlos Domingo T.: Se dedica a la  elavoracion de prendas de vestir variadas y serigrafia desde hace 4 años tiene su pequeño taller que esta ubicada en su casa el cuenta con empleados que le  ayudan a sacar los pedidos que el tiene cada semana sus hermanos le apoyan con ofrecer su producto el tiene 24 años aun vive con su madre, su papa fallecio hace 15 años y los dejo solo el desde pequeño inicio trabajando de casa en casa y asi sacar adelante a su mama y a sus hermanos pequeños su mayor deseo ahora es agrandar su taller y asi mismo comprar un pulpo instrumento que le ayuda para poder hacer la serigrafia a asi mismo comprar mas telas para confeccion de playeras.
texts.en:
Carlos Domingo T.'s business is making different types of clothes and silk screen printing.  He has been in this business for 4 years and has a small workshop in his home.  He has employees who help him to fill the orders that he has every week.  His siblings support him by selling his products.

Carlos is 24 years old and still lives with his mom.  His dad died 15 years ago and left them alone.  Carlos started working from house to house when he was little and thereby helped to get his mom and younger siblings ahead in life.  His greatest wish now is to expand his workshop, to buy an 'octopus' (a machine that will help him with his silk screen printing) and to buy more material for making t-shirts.

loans.use: to buy material for making t-shirts and to buy an 'octopus' (a machine used for silk screen printing)

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria Elena H. Martínez quien es estilista tuvo la idea de dedicarse a la venta de productos relacionados con la belleza con el propósito de contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad no gana lo suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. 

Debido a la situación, Gloria Elena se dio a la tarea de trabajar en su propio negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Gloria necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones básicas al negocio y comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta para ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena H. M., who is a beautician, decided to sell beauty products as well to contribute to the family’s expenses. Her husband works at a company in the city but does not earn enough to cover all the family’s needs. Because of this situation, Gloria Elena started her own business to improve her family’s quality of life. 

She needs the loan to make some improvements in the business and to buy more products to offer a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy variety of products.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chimarchaj Group

texts.es:
Teodola Ediberta G. G., es soltera, tine 27 años,  estudio solamente 1 año, se dedica a la confección D. prendas y a la crianza D. animales, tiene ya 15 años D. experiencia en la crianza D. animales, inicio este oficio con 1 solo animal, y en el futuro espera tener una minigranja.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR y poder ampliar el capital D. trabajo que ya tiene, el prestamo será utilizado para la compra D. pollos. Las integrante D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: La crianza D. anmales y la venta D. medicina. Esperan cumplir su objetivo con el préstamo que invertirán, D. mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodola Ediberta G. G. is 72 years old and single.  She only has a first graD. education and manufactures clothing and raises animals.  She has 15 years’ experience raising animals and began with a single animal.  She would like to have a small farm in the future.

She organized a group so that they could request a loan though ASDIR, which would allow her to expand her working capital.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens.  The members of the group have different businesses, such as raising animals and selling natural medicines.  They hope to accomplish their objectives and use the money to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nicanor; es soltero, el socio tiene 19 años de edad; y es considerado como el socio más joven del grupo, el socio es un chico muy hábil y lleno de deseos de triunfar en la vida, el socio se dedica a criar animales menores como son cuyes, el socio cuenta con un galpón de cuyes  y desea comprar 20 cuyes más para incrementar su galpón y gradualmente ir aumentando más y mientras van reproduciéndose los cuyes el socio venderá al por mayor a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, esta zona es muy bonita con un clima privilegiado y atrae a propios y turistas a pasar días aquí visitando el pueblo de Urubamba que es considerado cuna del valle sagrado de los inkas. El socio desea reunir su dinero y seguir creciendo en los negocios y también poder estudiar en la universidad, el es un joven con muchas aspiraciones. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicanor is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” which is located in the village of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 19 years old, single, and the youngest member of his group. Nicanor is a skillful young man who is filled with the desire to succeed in life. He raises domesticated animals such as guinea pigs. Nicanor has a guinea pig pen and wants to buy 20 more so that he can increase his inventory and allow them to reproduce. He sells the animals in bulk to different restaurants in the area. The beautiful town of Urubamba, which is considered to be the cradle of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, experiences a pleasant climate that attracts locals and tourists alike. Nicanor is in need of funds to continue growing his business and complete his studies at the university. He is a young man with many aspirations, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs.

Nicanor is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Matar Sougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Matar Sougou est créé le 9 avril 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui sont des parentes et voisines elles habitent le même quartier et leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

La responsable Fatou T. est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge; elle es âgée de 48 ans, elle est à droite sur la photo habillée en mauve et a croisé son bras sur son dos.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de denrées alimentaires et de vaisselles; elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine et ovine ; elle a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines. Elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes surtout la capitale Dakar et revend ses produits( bols,assiettes,denrées alimentaires etc.) dans le village et les marchés hebdomadaires.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer la quantité et la qualité de son activité pour avoir plus de revenus. 

Elle aide le Chef de famille dans la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes et la nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Matar Sougou solidarity group was created on April 9, 2011, the day of the Banc Villageois inauguration. It is composed of 29 women who are relatives and neighbors. They live in the same neighborhood and all work as vendors. 

Fatou T., the group’s leader is married, with four dependent children. She is 48 years old. She is on the right on the photo wearing a mauve outfit and holding her arm behind her back. She sells groceries and tableware. In addition, she also raises cows and sheep. She has a good experience in these areas. She stocks up in big cities, especially in Dakar, the country’s capital, and resells her wares (bowls, plates, groceries etc) in her village and at the weekly market. Her loan will allow her to improve the quantity and quality of her stock in order to increase her revenues. She helps her husband provide for everyday expenses and food for their children.

loans.use: to buy groceries and tableware for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 180 kgs of beet pulp

loans.name: Katiereton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATIERETON 3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 9 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Nimprodioula un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région  administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe d’hommes  sont généralement  le maïs  avec SOUNGALO. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter des intrants ( engrais et herbicide) et les petits matériels agricoles. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
SOUNGALO compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000 FCFA par campagne et souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Son ambition est d’acheter un vélo  pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group called KATIERETON 3 are married men with an average age of 50 and nine children, and most live in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages making up the township of Sikasso, (third administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to farm successfully during the rainy season. This is their second time working with the institution and their prior loan was correctly reimbursed. 

The crop cultivated by this group of men is generally maize, as is the case with Soungalo. With this new loan he intends to buy agricultural entrants (fertilizer and herbicide) and small agricultural tools. The crops are sold after harvest, both in the village and at the Sikasso market, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Soungalo expects to make an average profit of 115,000 F CFA per harvest and hopes to continue his collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. His ambition is to buy a bicycle for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, small agricultural tools, and herbicides.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 36 years old, married and has five children. Four of them are getting their education and the youngest one is only four years old and hasn’t started his education yet. Her husband makes gloves from leather and rexion. He is expert in his work and his customers are very much satisfied with his work, giving him regular orders as a result.
 
Nusrat is a housewife as well as a businesswoman. She is also involved in the glove-making business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her gloves-making business. With the loan, she will buy a glove-making machine that will allow her to fulfill the orders on time and earn more profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for the past 10 years. She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will be able to increase her profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy a glove-making machine

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.en:
Toirjon is a hardworking husband who is engaged in processing fruits. He works hard and his family helps in this business. This business is a family business. In the season, he purchases about 3000-3500 kg of fresh fruit. After processing, he has 700-850 kg dried fruit and 350 kg ossicle. From the profit that he made last year, he built two houses. Toirjon would like to get a loan of 4,000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots for processing. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
