While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots to sell

loans.name: Isaac Alberto

texts.es:
Isaac Alberto tiene 68 años, es soltero vive solo, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Canton Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.


Isacc se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentación para las pollos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta le gusta salir a visitar a los nietos.
texts.en:
Isaac Alberto is 68 years old, single, and he lives alone. He lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the city of Chillanes.

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca. He also raises poultry. He carries out his purchases in Chillanes and in San Pablo and he makes his sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

The loan will help him to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to feed his poultry. The loan will help him increase harvest production. He has faced challenges such as illnesses that struck the workers and plagues and diseases that affect the cultivations. His dream is to remain healthy and to keep working. 

He enjoys visiting with his grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jesús le está haciendo falta un cuarto.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y arena ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo en una fábrica pagara el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Diana se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y la calidad de vida, ya el cuarto que construirá será para que sus hijos tengan mas espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Jesus needs to add a room to his house.  He requests a loan so that he can buy materials such as: cement blocks, cement, metal rods and sand, since he is in charge of doing the improvements to the house in his free time.

With the income he earns from his job at a factory he will pay off the loan, since his wife Diana is in charge of the household expenses and education for their three children.  

He wants to improve his family's property and their quality of life.  The room that he will build will be for his sons, so that they can have more space in the home.

loans.use: to add a room onto the back of his house

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy est une jeune femme de 32 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le commerce et  la vente de crème, de glace, de savons et d’autres produits divers. Elle a choisi son  activité par nécessité car elle veut se procurer des revenus  de revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins sociaux car c’est elle meme qui doit se prendre en charge. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 3 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement et développer son activité. Le financement lui permettra d’acheter du savon et des produits qui sont utilisés pour faire les crèmes qu’elle commercialise. Oumy est une femme mariée et veut soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Oumy, 32, lives in Sénégal. She sells cremes, ice, soap, and various other products. She chose her business by necessity since she wants to make income which will allow her to support herself, since she has to be responsible for her own livelihood. She has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's branch offices for three years. 

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs that she will use to grow her working capital and develop her business. The loan will allow her to buy soap and products that are used to make the cremes she sells. Oumy is a married woman and wants to help her husband manage the family expenditures.

loans.use: to buy soap and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father of five children and a Rwandan rice farmer. He has been doing this work for the past five years. This business is one that he learned from his parents. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: preparing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labour on his rice farm

loans.name: Teresa Nelli

texts.es: Teresa Nelli tiene 56 años, la señora Teresa se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, cosméticos, bolsos y calzado. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cobertores, sabanas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, sandalias. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia.
texts.en: Teresa Nelli is 56 years old. Señora Teresa sells different types of merchandise, primarily clothes, cosmetics, handbags and footwear. She has had the business for more than 5 years. When she started she had a small amount of capital but she saved little by little until she had enough customers.The loan will be invested in the purchase of blankets, sheets, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals. Her goal is to have a store with a variety of products that members of her family can work in .

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is single and has no children. He is 46 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Mario sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this work. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase groceries for his general store. Mario has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Mario hopes to have a number of branches of his general store in the town.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for his general store

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, posee su propio negocio, que logro gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo de su esposo, una pulperia con mas de trece años en las ventas, y que ha venido incrementando mas productos de variedad con ganancias y financiamiento que ha logrado en Afodenic.
Lo que para ella ha sido de gran sastifaccion, ya que ha ayudado a su familia y a su hijo con los estudios y gastos del hogar. Su esposo sigue laborando como contador en una empresa privada.
Con los prestamo que ha hecho han sido para introducir mercaderia variada y hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, comprara tres quintales de azucar, tres quintales de arros y productos de la coca cola en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes owns her own business which she acquired thanks to the effort and support of her husband.  Her business is a grocery store and she has been selling for more than thirteen years.  She has been increasing her range of products with her profits and loans from Afodenic.  This is of great satisfaction to her as she has helped her family, helped her son with his education and helped with the household expenses.  Her husband continues working as an accountant in a private company.

Mercedes has used her loans to introduce a variety of merchandise into her store and she will use this new loan to buy three 100lb sacks of sugar, three 100lb sacks of rice and Coca Cola products in bulk.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains and Coca Cola products

loans.name: René Otoniel

texts.es:
René tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres. René se dedica a prestar servicios de publicidad por micrófono en distintos establecimientos en la ciudad.

René ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de materiales para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su casa. Con lo que él gana actualmente, René no ha podido reunir todo el dinero que necesita de una sola vez. El préstamo le ayudará a comprar todo lo necesario al mismo tiempo, y así él podra ir pagando poco a poco con la ayuda de su padre y su hermano. René quiere colocar energía eléctrica en su casa para que su familia no tenga que respirar los gases tóxicos que emite el candil que usan para alumbrar.

En un futuro René sueña con construir una casa digna para su familia. Actualmente viven en una casa con paredes hechas con pléstico negro (similar a una bolsa de basura), y el piso es de tierra. Con mucho esfuerzo René ha podido comprar un pequeño terreno. El sueña con ser un ejemplo para toda su familia.
texts.en:
René is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. René works as an in-house promoter at several establishments in the city. 

René has asked Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy the building materials necessary to install electricity in his house. With what he currently earns, René has not been able to save all the money needed to buy everything at one go. The loan will help him buy everything he needs at the same time. In this way he can pay off the loan little by little with the help of his father and brother. René wants to install electricty in his house so that the family does not have to breathe in the toxic fumes of the lamp they use for lighting. 
 
In the future, René dreams of building a house worthy of his family. They currently live in a house with walls made of black plastic (similar to black plastic garbage bags) and a dirt floor. With a lot of hard work, René has been able to buy a small piece of land. He dreams of being an example to the whole family.

loans.use: to buy the building materials necessary to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is single and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been operating a laundry business for the last eight years to make a living. Previously, she was selling polythene papers. She has employed two people to help her to manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Eunice is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cleaning (washing) machine.

loans.use: To buy a cleaning (washing) machine

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin, 38, is a rice cultivator from Kompong Chhnang province. She has spent most of her life doing this business. Ngin has a life partner in her husband who works as a joiner in mobile places. This couple is blessed with three children. Two of her children are garment factory workers in the province, while the other one is a student living under her support. 

Ngin always expects to lift her family from poverty by using all of her efforts; however, she is able to generate $1.50 each day. But now she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s funders to purchase rice to sell in the future. With the remaining fund, she’ll buy some piglets to raise in a wooden piggery behind her own house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell and piglets to raise

loans.name: Naomi Waithera

texts.en: Naomi Waithera, 34, is married to a businessman and they have a 12-year-old daughter. Naomi has a grocery shop where she sells vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, kales, carrots and cabbages. Besides this, she has a restaurant in the city market of Nairobi. Naomi's business is faced with the problem of ongoing construction of the Thika super highway. She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes. Naomi describes herself as honest and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a hardworking business woman aged 27 years-old. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend  school. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last three years in order to support her family. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Gladys has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. With 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she intends to buy animal feed. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business and have many cows. Gladys expresses gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mpayo

texts.en:
Mpayo is 25 years old, married, and has three children.  He practices livestock farming.  He has been in the business for eight years. The climate of his area is favorable for farming and he has enough grazing land.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business with his previous loan.

Mpayo hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years.  He has requested  40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Ilusión De Crecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Ilusión de Crecer” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, por mencionar algunos se encuentran la venta de ropa, preparación de comida típica del sur de Chile, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Castro.
Alejandra integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el tercer puesto de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo un buzo completo y zapatillas deportivas. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Sus productos los vende desde su propia casa y también los comercializa puerta a puerta, a sus conocidos y familiares. 
Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 3 meses, pero comenta que le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas, ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes y además está muy motivada de continuar, ya que comenta le brinda cierta independencia personal y con sus tiempos, ya que tiene la facilidad de flexibilizar sus horarios, para el cuidado de sus hijos. 
Su mercadería la compra al por mayor en el Barrio Meiggs, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas para su negocio son instalar su negocio en un local establecido.
Alejandra vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, para participar, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Por otro lado el grupo del Banco comunal es muy ameno, comprometido y existe una muy buena comunicación entre los emprendedores del grupo. 
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los Lagos, zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ilusión de Crecer” and has 18 members who are in different lines of work among which we can mention clothing sales and preparation of traditional dishes from southern Chile, among others.  All of them are from the city of Castro.

Alejandra is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the front row third from right to left wearing a sweatshirt and athletic shoes.  She sells used and new clothes.  She sells her items from home and also door to door to acquaintances and family members.

She’s been in this occupation for three years but comments that she’s done very well with her sales because she has a good number of customers and she’s also very motivated to continue because she comments that it provides her with certain personal and time independence because she can be flexible with her schedules and look after her children.

She buys her merchandise at wholesale in the Meiggs neighborhood located in the city of Santiago.  The loan is to buy clothing to stock her business.  Her business goal is to set up her store in a fixed locale.

Alejandra lives with her husband and two children who are 8 and 2 years old.  Her dream is to prosper in her business to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has provided her to participate because she’s been able to invest in her business.  On the other hand, the group in the communal bank is very pleasant and committed and a good communication exists among the entrepreneurs in the group.

Castro is the capital of Chiloé Island (the largest island in South America), in the Los Lagos Region in the south of Chile.  Its natural surroundings are preserved with almost no human intervention.  It has a culture that’s rich in myth and legends.  One of its greatest attractions is the “palafitos” (houses) built on wooden stilts along the shore over the sea.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Amal is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Amal is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her income and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jovelyn has a shop that sells vegetables such as squash, string-beans and spices. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables for resale.
Jovelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
La  señora María Gloria es una señora  trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa  para dama ,caballero y de dama.
También se dedica a la elaboración de bolsas artesanas , ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es darle una buena atención a sus clientes  para que se sienta contentos y regresen a su local.
Ellas nos cuenta que  parte de vender ropa y bolsas también vende antojitos mexicanos en las tardes para tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Roberto con quien tiene dos hijos a quien quiere y por lo cual trabaja para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para dama y niños que es la ropa que mas se vende en su localidad.
texts.en:
María Gloria is a hard-working woman who sells women's, men's and children's clothing.  She also makes hand-crafted bags and claims she enjoys attending to her customers well so they will always come back.

In addition to selling clothing and bags she also sells Mexican snack food in the afternoons for extra income in case any emergency should arise.

She is happily married to Roberto and they have two children for whom they want to provide a better lifestyle.  She is requesting a loan to buy more women's and children's clothing since these are what are in highest demand in her town.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Annah. She is a lovely self-driven smallholder farmer. She lives in Eldoret, Kenya, together with the husband to whom she has been married for over 10 years!  

Annah has been doing mixed-farming for two decades. She considers herself to be more passionate and hardworking than other farmers. She also leaves nothing to chance when carrying out her duties.

She is seeking a KES 130,000 loan to purchase farm equipment and a dairy cow. Acquisition of these assets is aligned to her plan of growing her agribusiness to the next level. On her farm, she grows two acres of maize. She also keeps four highly productive dairy cows, ten hens and goats. For the past few years, her biggest challenge has been the tools being used on the farm. They are outdated and worn out to say the least. As a result, farm work has become strenuous and time consuming. She spends more resources on labour since working with these tools requires a lot of effort yet the quality of work keeps deteriorating. 

Annah is going to use this loan to purchase modern farm equipment that will bring effectiveness and efficiency to her farm work. New improved tools will not only save her on labour costs but also improve the quality of work. The dairy cow she will acquire will boost the overall income she gets from milk.

Annah counts herself lucky to be among those who had a supportive upbringing being the third born in a family of seven children. She went through school and completed her secondary education without much difficulty. Today, the education she acquired helps her to keep her financial records straight through a budget that she reviews annually. She also stated that she always monitors and keeps records of her expenses.

loans.use: buy tools for farming

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es de la ciudad de Luque, está Casado con la Sra. Alba quien le ayuda con el trabajo de transporte escolar, tienen cuatros hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ambos pudieron sacar adelante.
El Sr. Francisco pide este préstamo para la compra de repuestos variados para poder usar en su taller, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos para autos.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy was born 43 years ago. She is married to a good man who supports her initiatives and they have 6 children. Two are in secondary school while the rest are in primary school. She works hard to make sure that her children get good education and the basic necessities of life. She sells milk and Napier grass. Milk sales contribute $28 whereas Napier grass contributes $ 71 per month. With an additional cow, she will have more milk and her income will increase gradually. This will help her to give the necessary support to her family.

loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Durdana

texts.en:
Durdana supplies milk in Khaladj village, Salyan region, where she lives with her 3 children . With this business she meets the demands of her family. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has a milk cow. 
Durdana plans to increase her production by buying a lot of milk cows to improve her dairy farm. Her cows provide her income and also provide milk for her family.
She requests a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Iloga

texts.en: Iloga is 33 years old and is married with two children.  Her husband has a job in town, but his wages aren’t enough to provide for the family.  She applied for a loan from SPBD in order to purchase the materials she needs to start an “ice cake” business.  She sells these flavored ices to the locals in her village.  These treats are especially popular with the children at the primary school.  She is able to earn approximately ST 20 – 30 (about USD 8 – 12) each day.  This is a valuable supplement to the family’s income.  Iloga will use additional loan funds to buy more supplies for making ice cakes, such as purified water, sugar and cordials.

loans.use: Buy purified water, sugar, cordials

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina has two small children who are 6 and 3. Her husband works as an electrician and as a construction worker. His earnings vary greatly and at times there is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. So, Paulina decided to start her own business, now five years ago, where she sold clothing. With time, her products became more varied and she now sells jewlery and women's purses as well. She began by selling items to her neighbors and to her friends. Now she has quite a number of customers and her allowing customers to buy on credit helps her to keep them.

Paulina is applying for a loan of $200.00 which she will repay in 3 months, and will be used to purchase merchandise and to have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. This way she can attract more customers and give her children better opportunities in life. She thanks you very much for your support in helping her achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Paulina tiene dos hijos pequeños de 6 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como electricista y construcción por su cuenta, y sus ingresos son muy variables y a veces no cuenta con lo necesario para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por ello es que Paulina decidió comenzar con su negocio, y fue hace 5 años que ella empezó con su negocio, inicialmente vendía ropa y con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando la gama de los productos que ofrece joyería y bolsas para dama, primero con sus vecinas y familiares y ya ahora tiene una cartera considerable de clientes y las formas de pago en abono que ofrece ayuda mucho a mantener sus clientes.

Paulina está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses, este lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería y tener mayor cantidad de productos variados que ofrecer y así obtener mayor cantidad de clientes y poder sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, ella te agradece mucho por tu apoyo en el logro de sus metas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mirna Edit

texts.en:
Mirna is married and has four children. Her husband is retired, but because his pension isn't enough to cover the family's expenses, Mirna started a business four years ago selling notions and gifts. She started with a small investment and little by little stocked a greater variety of products. She now sells a variety of paper and dry goods, along with movie rentals, which have had great results.

Mirna wants to take advantage of the back to school season to increase her sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase merchandise, to be repaid over 6 months. Mirna and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es jubilado y con la pensión que recibe era insuficiente cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que desde hace cuatro años iniciaron su negocio de venta de novedades y regalos, empezaron con poca inversión y poco a poco han ido surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrecen, incorporando artículos de papelería y mercería, ahora también han ofrecen la renta de películas obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Mirna quiere aprovechar esta temporada en la que es el regreso a clases para incrementar sus ventas y necesita comprar mercancía para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Mirna, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Mukaddas has a big multi-specialty sales business. She sells food products; owns a small store, which is managed by her niece; she also sells and delivers furniture from Tashkent, Uzbekistan. In addition, Mukaddas sells watermelons and honeydews. Her businesses bring good steady profit. Since receiving her first MicroInvest loan 3 years ago, Mukaddas noticeably expanded her business. She plans to invest this loan into store expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

У Мукаддас большой бизнес включающий в себя различные направления. Она продает продукты питания, держит маленький магазинчик, где торгует ее племянница, а также привозит мебель с Ташкента, Узбекистан. Также она продает арбузы и дыни. Все это приносит хорошую прибыль. Получив 3 года назад первый займ в Микроинвест Мукаддас с тех пор заметно расширила свой бизнес. С получением нового займа она собирается вложить его в свой магазин.

loans.use: Store expansion

loans.name: Juana Rina

texts.en:
Juana is a caring and insightful mother of four. Her three oldest children are 27, 26, and 24, and her youngest daughter is 9 years old. She has a business cooking food, such as stuffed potatoes and picarones (a doughnut type dessert), which she sells to friends and neighbors from her home on the weekends. She sells the stuffed potatoes for one Sol apiece, about 35 cents. She also occasionally prepares lunches for schools.

Juana’s husband is the driver of a combi (a small bus very common in Lima), and they live in their own home with three of their children- their oldest is married and lives with her in-laws. During the week Juana is busy taking care of their youngest daughter. She says this can be exhausting, getting her ready each morning and helping her study each afternoon, and making sure she gets to all of her activities. She loves her village bank for the adult community it brings her. She says the meetings are stimulating for her mind and she enjoys the challenge it brings to her life. With this loan of $425 Juana will buy potatoes, flour, oil, onions, meat, and some new plates with which to serve the food.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, flour, oil, onions, meat, and some new plates with which to serve the food

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Murodjon lives with his mother and sells mobile phones on a market. His mother works as a teacher at a local school. He came to MicroInvest because he desperately needed money to purchase additional inventory and increase the assortment of his goods. With the income that he earns, he helps his mother.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Муродджон живет один с матерью, он продает мобильные телефоны на рынке. Его мать работает в школе преподавателем. Ему срочно понадобились деньги, занять не у кого. Для этого он обратился в Микроинвест. Теперь он может купить на полученные деньги товар, увеличить ассортимент. Доход которую он получает , помогает матери.

loans.use: Sales of cell phones

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona P. has a store for clothing sales in the center of the city, in a very commercial zone visited primarily by tourists and office workers that work in the area as there are many office buildings nearby. She sales mainly women’s clothing, and a few items for men as well. Among the items she offers, we can include: skirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, capris, dress pants and jeans, dresses, etc.

She obtained her own business with much sacrifice, working arduously for several years to be able to save enough money to invest. The Fundación Paraguaya was a great help also, given that it helped her get access to loans so she could start her business.

These days, she can be found very content at her endeavor, given that she generates enough income to support her home as well as to provide for her childrens’ basic needs and educations. She seeks a credit to invest in the purchase of additional merchandise, particularly for the summer months, as she has received many requests for such inventory from her most frequent customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona P. posee un puesto de ventas de ropas en el centro de la ciudad, en una zona muy comercial, visitada principalmente por turistas y oficinistas que trabajan en la zona ya que hay muchos edificios. Ella vende principalmente ropas para damas, y algunas para caballeros. Entre las prendas que ofrece podemos citar: remeras, faldas, camisas, blusas, shorts, capris, pantalones de tela y de jeans, vestidos, etc.

Cuenta que con mucho sacrificio pudo lograr obtener su propio negocio, pues trabajo arduamente durante varios años para poder ahorrar su dinero y formar su capital. La Fundación Paraguaya fue de gran ayuda también ya que le facilito los créditos para que ella pueda iniciar su negocio.

Hoy día, ella se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le genera las ganancias suficientes para mantener su hogar, y darles a sus hijos educación, ropas, y comida. Ella solicita un crédito que los desea invertir en la compra de mas mercaderías especialmente de la temporada verano, pues en este mes ha recibido muchos pedidos de sus clientes más frecuentes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing/merchandise: dresses, blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is a 50 year-old widow. She supports her five children by selling rice porridge, which is a popular breakfast dish in Ghana. She is requesting $275 to buy rice in bulk from a wholesaler so she can reduce her costs.

Sarah is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from a wholesaler so she can reduce her costs.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarat O. has been married for twenty five years. She has six children—two sons and four daughters. Three of her children are employed full time and the other three are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. O. has been a farmer since she was young. She grows rice on the farm near the village. Her husband is seriously ill.

Mrs. O. is requesting a loan for the second time. She is asking for $100 to pay a fee for plowing.

loans.use: To pay a fee for plowing

loans.name: Emerlith

texts.es:
Mrs. Emerlith T. S. is a member of the "Vision 2000" Communal Bank. She lives in San Martin Region, Picota province in the district of San Hilarion. She sells prepared meals daily to provide good customer service. She started her business to provide a better education for her children, but she previously had a kiosk. Now, she sells food in her restaurant and offers a variety of dishes in this rented space. Thanks to her perseverance and her desire to succeed she was able to acquire what she has now. With a loan of $750.00 to be paid within 6 months, she will invest in equipping the restaurant with new kitchen utensils, such as pots in various sizes, crockery and cutlery, and also buy non-perishable ingredients to prepare the various dishes that she offers her customers daily. Emerlith is an enthusiastic and cheerful 53-year-old woman. Together with her husband and with humility that she shows, she wants to contribute to the progress of the community who gave her a chance to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Emerlith T. S., es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín Provincia Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de comida diaria acondicionado para brindar buena atención al cliente, La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio ,ya que anteriormente tenía un kiosco , y ahora se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante con la preparación de variedades de comidas tipo menú , en un ambiente alquilado, gracias a su perseverancia, ganas de salir adelante, pudo obtener lo que ahora tiene. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses lo invertirá en la implementación el restaurante con utensilios nuevos de cocina, como ollas de diferentes tamaño, vajilla y cubiertos, así también comprará los insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela. Emerlith es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con 53 años, que junto a su esposo y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase products such as utensils, cookware, and non-perishable food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Cảnh is 55 years old. She is a 4th year member of TYM fund. She has a big family and they rely on the fishing as their source of income. Fishing is a good business, it can provide her family a steady income. Since she joins TYM, her family living condition has improved a lot. Her family income is at 180 USD a month. She also farm her rice paddy and raises livestock. Since the fishing equipment is old, it limits their ability to fish. She is requesting 750 USD to buy a new boat and a motor.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Cảnh, 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Là một gia đình thuộc vùng giáo dân, lại đông con nhưng có nghề phụ là đánh cá sông nên cuộc sống cũng no đủ. Nghề cá vừa đảm bảo được nguồn thức ăn cho gia đình lại có thu nhập ổn định, thường xuyên, thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Tham gia vào tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn và biết sử dụng hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt. Mỗi tháng thu nhập bình quân từ nghề cá khoảng 180USD. Ngoài ra chị Cảnh còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Thời gian gần đây các đồ nghề đều cũ nên việc đánh bắt cũng bị hạn chế. Vòng vốn này chị Cảnh xin vay 750USD để mua 1 chiếc thuyền và máy mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing boat

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng L., 53, is a widowed grocery store worker who lives in Siem Reap Province. She has thirteen children, but they have all married and moved out of the home. As a grocery store worker, she typically makes $2 each day and is now in need of some capital. Inflation has been soaring in Cambodia over the course of the past year, and food prices are very high, substantially increasing the economic struggles many Cambodians experience. Cheng L., seeking to increase her income and improve her standard of living, has asked for a loan of $500. With that loan, she would like to purchase more groceries and expand her business, while using the remaining money to repair her home’s leaky roof.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and repair a leaky roof.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mrs Awa D. is married and has 4 children to support. With this loan, she wishes to bolster her business, that consists in selling vegetables and other food products. She intends to go the capital, Dakar, to purchase rice, corn, and vegetables, and to resell them in Ziguinchor, where she already has potential customers. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Awa D. est mariée et a 04 enfants à charge. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de ventes de légumes et autres produits alimentaires. Elle va ainsi s’approvisionner en riz, maïs et légumes à la capitale à Dakar et venir les écouler à Ziguinchor où elle dispose déjà d’une clientèle potentielle. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: To bolster her business selling vegetables and other food products

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Navy Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of twelve people is located in Ta Skor Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Phan N. is the Village Bank President and she is a house wife. Her husband, Mr. Im Sophak, is a fisherman who now faces a small problem in his business because he does not have enough fishing equipment. In order to improve his business, Mrs. Phan N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets for her husband’s business. Mrs. Phan N. is 36 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in small positions in a TV Company whilst the other three are attending the local school. The youngest one is only one year old.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her husband business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Piedras”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y frutas, sobre todo plátanos. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Miraflores  Nº 250. Las frutas las lleva al mercado de la ciudad de Tarapoto para venderlas al por mayor, y de esa manera abastece a los vendedores minoristas de frutas.
 
Decide iniciarse en el negocio por la iniciativa de su mamá para poder generar ingresos y contribuir en los gastos de su casa y las de su hijo, ya que ella es madre soltera. Ahora está agradecida a su mamá porque le está yendo muy bien, empezó sólo con frutas y ahora vende también abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual cancelará en 6 meses comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche en tamaño grande y pequeño en cajas, fideos, papel higiénico, sal en paquetes, sillao, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, sardinas, papa, cebolla, tomate, entre otros, y una parte también lo invertirá en frutas y de esa manera podrá surtir el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  

Tiene 39  años de edad, vive con su hijo que aun dependen de ella,  es una mujer muy entusiasta y perseverante, le gusta el negocio, tiene como meta tener su casa propia y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita, member of the "Rock" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin, in the province of Lamas, in the district of Tabalosos. She sells groceries and fruit, especially bananas. The business is located in her own house, at 250 Jr. Mifraflores street. Margarita brings the fruits to the Tarapoto city market to sell them to the public, and to other small fruit vendors. It was her mom's idea that Margarita begin this business so that she could earn an income and contribute to the family's expenses as well as her son's, as Margarita is a single mother. Now she is thankful for her mother's idea because business is going well. She began only selling fruits, but now she sells groceries as well. With the 2,000 soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk in bulk and in individual containers, noodles, toilet paper, packets of salt, soy-sauce, a variety of sizes and brands of soft drinks, sardines, potatoes, onions, and tomatoes among other things. She will also purchase fruit, and in this way be able to supply her business and satisfy the clients' needs. She is 39 years old, and lives with her son, who is still her dependent. Margarita is an enthusiastic and persevering woman. She likes her business. Her goal is to own her own house and to continue supplying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. as well as fruit.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Hawa G. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of two and ten. Hawa has been running a business since 2005, selling women's shoes. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Hawa currently earns about 400USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more women's shoes. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Hawa thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more women's shoes

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanty Y. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder for a living. 

She faces an obstacle because she does not have much money to support and grow her business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and six piglets to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. Keov Sokeoun, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Mrs. Chanty Y. is 20 years old and she does not have a child yet. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and six piglets to add to her business.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates at seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Véronique K. has six children, ages 17, 23, 25, 28, 33, and 35; each educated before entering the workforce. She is a smiling, grandmother of 55 years old and has a business selling akassa to hungry locals. 

Véronique melts corn flour in a large, black cauldron in her house. Her family members help her to clean large leaves. Véronique then puts the corn flour into large leaves to make the tasty akassa snack. Akassa is her most lucrative activity, followed by the sale of motorcycle oil and charcoal. 15 years ago when she first started her business, she sold smoked fish. She gives the finished akassa snacks to others to sell, which takes them approximately three days or more to sell and pay her back. The turnaround time sometimes makes it difficult for her to make ends meet. 

In the future, she would like to increase her capacity to cook akassa by purchasing at least one extra large cooking pot.

loans.use: Purchase of akassa ingredients, charcoal, and motorcycle oil

loans.name: Twebaze Lending Group

texts.en: B. Solome is the chairperson of the Twebaze lending group in Jungo. She is 40 years old, married and has 7 children, all attending school. She also cares for 2 orphan children belonging to her late brother, including paying their school fees, clothing, medical care and general upkeep. Solome has a retail shop business that she has been running for over 5 years. The loans have been used to re-invest into her business, enabling her to buy more stock in her shop like sugar, soap, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, etc The profits she earns are used for her children's school fees. Solome's husband is a farmer. He sells his harvests locally as well as at the large farmers market in Kibuye. Solome is requesting a loan to help her with restocking her shop in preparation for the beginning of the school term which is next month.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with sugar, salt, maize flour and other products.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 48, and her husband, Mr. Roeun Khiev, 49, have been married for 20 years and have six children: two sons and four daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; two daughters are garment factory workers; one son is a driver, and two children attend school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sokha is a housewife. She looks after her house and takes care of the children. Roeun has been a driver for a construction company for fourteen years. Currently, their daughters go to work by motor taxi and the cost is high and they decided to buy a motorbike for their daughters to ride to work but they lack money to do so.

Therefore, Sokha is requesting her first loan of US$ 500 to buy a motorbike for her daughters to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughters to ride to work.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Agnes is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is an administrator in PACT Sudan. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to increase her income.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. D. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 D. Julio”, en el barrio progreso, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 59 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella se dedica a la artesanía en miniatura (fabrica D. autos D. metal en miniatura) para la venta en ferias costumbristas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. materiales (lata, aluminio y pintura) para su trabajo artesanal. 
Ella requiere un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con el dinero piensa adquirir mas materiales al por mayor (lata, aluminio, pintura, estaño, crema soldadora, etc.) a fin D. continuar elaborando sus productos artesanales y tener mercadería disponible, ella tiene el anhelo D. adquirir en el futuro una casa en la ciudad D. Puno o Juliaca, por ello viene ahorrando sus ganancias D. su negocio. Asimismo agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado, ya que los préstamos que le dan le sirven para poder realizar las actividades  que a ella mas le gusta.
texts.en:
Petrona C. D. R. is a member of the Unión 28 D. Julio ('Union of July 28') community bank in the Progreso neighborhood of Yunguyo district, which is in the Yunguyo province of the department of Puno. She is 59-years old, has a live-in partner and five children, and completed primary school education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. Petrona makes miniature handicraft (factory that makes model cars from metal) which is then sold at traditional folk art fairs. Her first loan of 500 PEN was invested in the purchase of materials (tin, aluminum, and paint) for her craft work. Petrona needs a new loan of 1,500 PEN, which she promises to repay in three monthly payments. With this money she would like to acquire materials at wholesale prices (tin, aluminum, paint, pewter, soldering paste, etc.), in order to continue her craft work and have merchandise available. Petrona wishes to buy a house in Puno or Juliaca in the future, therefore she is saving the profits from her business. In addition, she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support, as the loans they give her enable her to do the activities that she likes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as tin, aluminum, paint, pewter, etc.

loans.name: Marlene De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Marlene tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, tiene dos niños gemelos, su esposo es coordinador de red de Enitel, el negocio de doña Marlene es la venta de cosmético y prendas de plata, lleva dos años en las ventas el cual inicio para obtener sus propios ingresos y superarse. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para invertir en la compra de perfúmenes y más prenda de plata, que se venden mucho a los jóvenes, al contado y al crédito, sus planes es poder poner una tienda grande con productos variados, que le generen buenas ganancias. También poder apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38 and lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district. She has twins. Her husband is a network coordinator for Enitel. Marlene sells cosmetics and silver jewelry.

She set up the business two years ago in order to obtain her own income and to progress. She will use the loan to buy perfumes and silver jewelry to sell to young people, both for cash and on credit.

She plans to set up a big store with a range of products that will provide her with a good income. She also wants to support her children so that they can study.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, perfume and jewelry

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. is 35 years old. She is married and a mother with three children. Her husband is a (galamsey) operator, that is he is gold miner and electrician. Diana lives in a mining community where most of the men are gold miners. This has created job opportunities for many youth in the community where Diana lives. 

She is a food vendor who sells fried yam and fried fish. Fried yam is enjoyed by almost every Ghanaian, especially for lunch. She purchases her stock of yam and fish in bulk, from the farming communities. Diana arranges the fried yam in a transparent showcase with fish and pepper. She sells mostly mostly through hawking. She has been in this business for a year. She requests a loan to buy more tubers of yam and fish to prepare her food. With the loan she believes she will have the increased resources to support her husband in providing a better education for her family. She therefore will be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literally means God’s family.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yam and fish for resale

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa F. is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Bolibol, Oroquuieta City. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs. In order to increase her earnings, she decided to sell hogs at the market. 

Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she obtained the capital to purchase the original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 ($100 US) to buy additional feed and to expand her hog-raising business. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pigpen to provide more sanitary conditions. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and will benefit her family, supplementing her husband's income. She dreams that someday she will be able to provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy feed for hog raising.
